question: ESS
answer:
Hello! 😊 

**Employee Self-Service (ESS)**

The Employee Self-Service (ESS) is a digital platform that allows associates to manage various personal and work-related tasks efficiently. Here are some key features and functionalities of ESS:

- **Address Update**: Associates can update their home and temporary addresses under the HR Self-Service section .

- **Contact Information**: It is essential for associates to keep their contact numbers updated in the 'Communication' section of ESS .

- **Transport Services**: Associates can request transport services (like Employee Transport Services, BPO, and taxi rentals) through the ESS platform. This includes scheduling pickups and managing transport requests .

- **Budget Monitoring System (BMS)**: Access to the Budget Monitoring System is available through ESS for associates in specific roles (GrM and above). If access is needed, associates can raise an iQuery ticket .

- **Management Applications**: ESS provides access to various management applications, including the Budget Management System .

For more detailed information, you can refer to the specific documents or links provided in the retrieved data.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What specific tasks can I perform through the Employee Self-Service platform?
2. How do I access the Budget Monitoring System through ESS?
3. Are there any training resources available for using the ESS effectively?

context.content:
In general, transport services (ETS, BPO & taxi-rentals) are provided by Bosch-sourced service 

providers. The request shall be raised using the online tool under Employee services -> Travel -

> Transport Services, including from mobile application. 

5 ETS - (Employee Transport Services – General Shift and 
BPO) 

 

5.1 Registration in Transport Tool 

Associates are requested to update their respective address under ESS > HR Self-Service > 

Personal information > Address Data > Home address > Temporary address. They should also 

update their contact number under ‘Communication’.  

The associate should first update the address in HR data and then only should download 

MoveInSync mobile application through Play Store for Android and through App Store for IOS. 

Once the application has been downloaded, the associate can key-in their official mail ID for sign 

up and get registered for the respective technology support. It is mandatory for all associates to 

select their respective nodal point (locality) for further action. 

5.2 Scheduling in the Tool 

Associates are requested to schedule their regular pickup, with both login and logout schedule, 

well before the cut-off time for the maximum period of 5 working days for the upcoming week. 

This is applicable to both general shift associates and associates who work 24/7 round the clock 

(BPO). Only the associates who are authorized for 24/7 shifts are requested to schedule for their 

shift timings. Vehicles will be deployed based on occupancy and the same will be published via 

mobile application/web access. For the day operation (0601hrs to 1900hrs), nodal pickup and 

drop will be considered. Residential pickup and drop will be considered for the shift operation 



  Management System Policy                  Page 6 of 15 

QSPL-FCM-04 BGSW Transport Policy (All Locations)  Version 2.0

Question 628) My project is not appearing in prime tool timesheet, Due to this I am not able to fill the efforts. Please help me as soon as possible since the period is about to get closed?  
Answer: If the scheduled task in MPP, is not reflecting in Timesheet. Please watch this [ Video]( https://tube.video.bosch.com/playlist/dedicated/2109/0_adkvzp4m/0_vvz5bo7u) to see the possible causes for the same and steps to overcome.  

Question 629) I am not able to find how many have submitted the timesheet in History.  
Answer: If you are interested to see the daily saved/submitted/approved efforts then please go through 'Effort Dashboard' [ link]( https://app.powerbi.com/reportEmbed?reportId=f6967fb1-0edc-46bc-9eb0-25177cb681f0&autoAuth=true&ctid=0ae51e19-07c8-4e4b-bb6d-648ee58410f4).   And if you want to see how many of your associates are not submitted the timesheet then go through this Bosch Connect [ link](https://connect.bosch.com/wikis/home?lang=en-us#!/wiki/W4591d755da0e_4aee_85c3_ff1f1b256ff0/page/How%20to%20find%20the%20list%20of%20Timesheets%20not%20submitted%20by%20associates).   In case you just need to check names of associates who have entered timesheet for today, you can refer "Today's Timesheet Effort" option available in PRIME home page  

Question 630) My project is applicable for Cost of Quality report but not able to find in the list.  
Answer: Be notified that:   1.Cost of Quality Report is Not applicable for : RA / Innovation / Competency / ESS / Agile - SCRUM / Agile - SAFe category of projects.

context.content:
Applicable to all BGSW on-roll associates, external associates, trainees & interns. To have hassle-free transport under digital platform at Ban, Cob, Hyd & Pune.
Responsibility
FCM Department
Process Description
In general, transport services (ETS, BPO & taxi-rentals) are provided by Bosch-sourced service providers. The request shall be raised using the online tool under Employee services -> Travel -> Transport Services, including from mobile application.
ETS - (Employee Transport Services – General Shift and BPO)

Registration in Transport Tool
Associates are requested to update their respective address under ESS > HR Self-Service > Personal information > Address Data > Home address > Temporary address. They should also update their contact number under ‘Communication’. 
The associate should first update the address in HR data and then only should download MoveInSync mobile application through Play Store for Android and through App Store for IOS. Once the application has been downloaded, the associate can key-in their official mail ID for sign up and get registered for the respective technology support. It is mandatory for all associates to select their respective nodal point (locality) for further action.
Scheduling in the Tool
Associates are requested to schedule their regular pickup, with both login and logout schedule, well before the cut-off time for the maximum period of 5 working days for the upcoming week. This is applicable to both general shift associates and associates who work 24/7 round the clock (BPO). Only the associates who are authorized for 24/7 shifts are requested to schedule for their shift timings. Vehicles will be deployed based on occupancy and the same will be published via mobile application/web access. For the day operation (0601hrs to 1900hrs), nodal pickup and drop will be considered. Residential pickup and drop will be considered for the shift operation (1901hrs to 0600hrs). Residential pickup/drop will be done only at the address mentioned in HR data.

question: Where can I find the list of active Resource Augmentation tasks?
answer:
The list of active Resource Augmentation tasks can be found in the Effort Data for BEST Report. To access this report, navigate to:

**PRIME PWA Home Page**  
> Custom Reports > 'Effort Data For BEST Report'

Additionally, project effort and non-project effort can also be accessed through the **Effort Dashboard** at the following link: [Effort Dashboard](https://app.powerbi.com/reportEmbed?reportId=f6967fb1-0edc-46bc-9eb0-25177cb681f0&autoAuth=true&ctid=0ae51e19-07c8-4e4b-bb6d-648ee58410f4) .

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What are the steps to create a Resource Augmentation project?
2. How can I access the Effort Dashboard?
3. Are there any specific permissions required to view the Effort Data for BEST Report?

context.content:
Prime - FAQs

Question 1) I have noticed in few projects, all the tasks are closed in Microsoft Project Professional but when I generate the Data Analysis Report , I noticed that the actual finish date is blank.  
Answer: Please check the From and To Date range provided for the generation of the DAR report. It is possible that Actual Finish date of the task is after the To Date provided in the report.   First refer the "Actual Finish" date of the tasks in the project schedule file. Then, check the date range provided in the report.   Raise an [ Service-now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the below details:   a. Project ID   b. Project Name    

Question 2) After change of my domain from APAC to US, I am not able to access Prime tool.  
Answer: Please raise an [ Service-now](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) ticket with the below details:   1\. Employee number   2\. NT/User id   3\. Current domain  

Question 3) Where can I find the list of active Resource Augmentation tasks?  
Answer: Overall functionality of the Effort Upload Utility is explained in the [ video](https://tube.video.bosch.com/playlist/dedicated/2109/0_8m0cd2jm/0_t6r0fo02).  

Question 4) Timesheet submitted for approval without changing the timesheet manager to the current manage Can I recall the timesheet?  
Answer: If the timesheet period is not closed then steps to change timesheet manager are   1\. Go to PRIME -> Timesheets -> select that CW timesheet > Click the Recall/Delete option on the top left of the screen.   2\. Update the Timesheet Manager name by navigating to "My Timesheet Manager" page.   3\. Once the timesheet manager name is updated successfully, then navigate back to timesheet details page. Enter the effort and submit the timesheet.  

Question 5) Not able to generate Data Analysis Report for a particular duration.

Addition to this PMs can also verify:   1.If Column "Publish" is set to Yes.   2.Resource Name and the Assignment Owner name should be same. Question 125) How to change the timesheet manager of a submitted timesheet?  
Answer: If the timesheet period is not closed then steps to change timesheet manager are   1\. Go to PRIME -> Timesheets -> select that CW timesheet > Click the Recall/Delete option on the top left of the screen.   2\. Update the Timesheet Manager name by navigating to "My Timesheet Manager" page.   3\. Once the timesheet manager name is updated successfully, then navigate back to timesheet details page. Enter the effort and submit the timesheet.  

Question 126) Issue in opening the Data Analysis Report?  
Answer: Be notified about some important information to access Data Analysis Report:   1) Reports in PRIME are generally accessible by the following category of users:   * PMs and proxy PMs   * First level management and above   * QAs (FPQs, Sub-Key Account QAs, etc.)   2) Please refer the DAR [ Help Dashboard](https://bgsw-primepha.apac.bosch.com/PRIMECustomReports/Areas/Help%20Documents/DataAnalysisReportHelp.html?Instance=rbei)in PRIME for more information on DAR Report access permission   3) Select the Org details , Project , Report Name, and the Date range.   4) Please raise an [ Service-now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the below details:   a. Project ID   b. Project Name    

Question 127) How to access PRIME while on deputation?  
Answer: Please raise an [ Service-now](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) ticket with the below details:   1\. Employee number   2\. NT/User id   3\. Current domain  

Question 128) Who can create Resource Augmentation projects?  
Answer: Resource Augmentation (RA) projects are created like any other projects within project registration module in PROMISE. The process of creating RA projects is same as any other project.   Project creation is not done in PRIME

Question 121) To approve the timesheet and view the history is taking more time?  
Answer: The approval of timesheets may be taking long time due to the following reasons:   1\. The PRIME service could be currently experiencing a high volume of server traffic. Please try again later.   2\. Please raise an [ Service-now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items).  

Question 122) I am unable to access the Data Analysis Report in PRIME.  
Answer: Be notified about some important information to access Data Analysis Report:   1) Reports in PRIME are generally accessible by the following category of users:   * PMs and proxy PMs   * First level management and above   * QAs (FPQs, Sub-Key Account QAs, etc.)   2) Please refer the DAR [ Help Dashboard](https://bgsw-primepha.apac.bosch.com/PRIMECustomReports/Areas/Help%20Documents/DataAnalysisReportHelp.html?Instance=rbei)in PRIME for more information on DAR Report access permission   3) Select the Org details , Project , Report Name, and the Date range.   4) Please raise an [ Service-now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the below details:   a. Project ID   b. Project Name    

Question 123) How to access PRIME temporarily to enter effort, I recently returned from deputation?  
Answer: Please raise an [ Service-now](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) ticket with the below details:   1\. Employee number   2\. NT/User id   3\. Current domain  

Question 124) How to create Resource Augmentation project in PRIME?  
Answer: Resource Augmentation (RA) projects are created like any other projects within project registration module in PROMISE. The process of creating RA projects is same as any other project.   Project creation is not done in PRIME

Answer: It is certainly not recommended to change the Project Location in PROMISE. Though, you can initiate Project Closure and create a new project with the correct location details. **Note:**   In case the Project location change is required, then please raise an iQuery ticket with an approval mail from the CTG team. On receipt of the request, the required changes or updates are initiated at the backend.  

Question 692) Due to a system issue, we could not see the project type. Now it is reflecting as NA. How to update it to Resource Augmentation.?  
Answer: The First Level Management (FLM) can change the Resource Augmentation (RA) by using the 'Revisit PC' option.  

Question 693) I am not able to change the Resource Augmentation type by clicking on the modify tab?  
Answer: The First Level Management (FLM) can change the Resource Augmentation (RA) by using the 'Revisit PC' option.  

Question 694) Unable to change the Resource Augmentation in PROMISE?  
Answer: The First Level Management (FLM) can change the Resource Augmentation (RA) by using the 'Revisit PC' option.  

Question 695) Who can change the Resource Augmentation in PROMISE?  
Answer: The First Level Management (FLM) can change the Resource Augmentation (RA) by using the 'Revisit PC' option.  

Question 696) Can the sub project end date be changed in PROMISE?  
Answer: The Sub-Project end date can be changed in PROMISE by the parent Project PM or the Sub Project Initiator.  

Question 697) Is it possible to change the sub-project end date in PROMISE?  
Answer: The Sub-Project end date can be changed in PROMISE by the parent Project PM or the Sub Project Initiator.  

Question 698) Who can change the sub project end date?  
Answer: The Sub-Project end date can be changed in PROMISE by the parent Project PM or the Sub Project Initiator.  

Question 699) Values are not updated in the staffing model.  
Answer: Only if the Revisit PC is computed, the value will be auto-populated. This will trigger a workflow to DQA and MM.

question: Hey BGSW what is ESS
answer:
**Employee Self-Service (ESS)**

Employee Self-Service (ESS) is a digital platform that allows associates to manage their personal information and access various services related to their employment. Here are some key features of ESS:

- **Personal Information Management**: Associates can update their personal details, such as home address and contact numbers, through the ESS portal .

- **Transport Services**: Employees can request transport services, including Employee Transport Services (ETS), BPO, and taxi rentals, via the online tool under Employee services .

- **Timesheet Management**: ESS provides functionalities for submitting and managing timesheets, including options for regularizing efforts not booked .

- **Access to Budget Management System**: Employees can navigate to the Budget Management System through the ESS page under Management Application .

For more detailed information, you can refer to the relevant documents or links provided in the responses.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What specific services can I access through the ESS platform?
2. How do I update my personal information in ESS?
3. Are there any training resources available for using ESS effectively?

context.content:
In general, transport services (ETS, BPO & taxi-rentals) are provided by Bosch-sourced service 

providers. The request shall be raised using the online tool under Employee services -> Travel -

> Transport Services, including from mobile application. 

5 ETS - (Employee Transport Services – General Shift and 
BPO) 

 

5.1 Registration in Transport Tool 

Associates are requested to update their respective address under ESS > HR Self-Service > 

Personal information > Address Data > Home address > Temporary address. They should also 

update their contact number under ‘Communication’.  

The associate should first update the address in HR data and then only should download 

MoveInSync mobile application through Play Store for Android and through App Store for IOS. 

Once the application has been downloaded, the associate can key-in their official mail ID for sign 

up and get registered for the respective technology support. It is mandatory for all associates to 

select their respective nodal point (locality) for further action. 

5.2 Scheduling in the Tool 

Associates are requested to schedule their regular pickup, with both login and logout schedule, 

well before the cut-off time for the maximum period of 5 working days for the upcoming week. 

This is applicable to both general shift associates and associates who work 24/7 round the clock 

(BPO). Only the associates who are authorized for 24/7 shifts are requested to schedule for their 

shift timings. Vehicles will be deployed based on occupancy and the same will be published via 

mobile application/web access. For the day operation (0601hrs to 1900hrs), nodal pickup and 

drop will be considered. Residential pickup and drop will be considered for the shift operation 



  Management System Policy                  Page 6 of 15 

QSPL-FCM-04 BGSW Transport Policy (All Locations)  Version 2.0 

© This is the exclusive property of Bosch Global Software Technologies Private Limited.

Question 628) My project is not appearing in prime tool timesheet, Due to this I am not able to fill the efforts. Please help me as soon as possible since the period is about to get closed?

Question 629) I am not able to find how many have submitted the timesheet in History.  
Answer: If you are interested to see the daily saved/submitted/approved efforts then please go through 'Effort Dashboard' [ link]( https://app.powerbi.com/reportEmbed?reportId=f6967fb1-0edc-46bc-9eb0-25177cb681f0&autoAuth=true&ctid=0ae51e19-07c8-4e4b-bb6d-648ee58410f4).   And if you want to see how many of your associates are not submitted the timesheet then go through this Bosch Connect [ link](https://connect.bosch.com/wikis/home?lang=en-us#!/wiki/W4591d755da0e_4aee_85c3_ff1f1b256ff0/page/How%20to%20find%20the%20list%20of%20Timesheets%20not%20submitted%20by%20associates).   In case you just need to check names of associates who have entered timesheet for today, you can refer "Today's Timesheet Effort" option available in PRIME home page  

Question 630) My project is applicable for Cost of Quality report but not able to find in the list.  
Answer: Be notified that:   1.Cost of Quality Report is Not applicable for : RA / Innovation / Competency / ESS / Agile - SCRUM / Agile - SAFe category of projects.

2.2 General ISO-GPS standards 

3 Concepts, principals and rules acc. to ISO 8015:2011

4. Dimensional tolerances (ISO 14405) 

1 Problem of unambiguous sizes 

2 Feature of size with linear sizes-terms acc. to ISO 14405-1: 2017 

3 Linear distances and radii (non-sizes) acc. to ISO 14405-2: 2017 

4 feature of size with angular size-terms acc. to ISO 14405-3:2017 

5 Two-point-size and consequences for technical drawings 

6 Envelope requirement acc. to ISO 14405-1 

7 Modifiers to specify the linear size characteristic (“GG”, “GN”, “LP”, etc.)

3 Specification of datums and datum systems

5 Common datum established from more than one feature 

6 Specification of datums and datum systems

ETS - (Employee Transport Services – General Shift and BPO)

Registration in Transport Tool
Associates are requested to update their respective address under ESS > HR Self-Service > Personal information > Address Data > Home address > Temporary address. They should also update their contact number under ‘Communication’. 
The associate should first update the address in HR data and then only should download MoveInSync mobile application through Play Store for Android and through App Store for IOS. Once the application has been downloaded, the associate can key-in their official mail ID for sign up and get registered for the respective technology support. It is mandatory for all associates to select their respective nodal point (locality) for further action.
Scheduling in the Tool
Associates are requested to schedule their regular pickup, with both login and logout schedule, well before the cut-off time for the maximum period of 5 working days for the upcoming week. This is applicable to both general shift associates and associates who work 24/7 round the clock (BPO). Only the associates who are authorized for 24/7 shifts are requested to schedule for their shift timings. Vehicles will be deployed based on occupancy and the same will be published via mobile application/web access. For the day operation (0601hrs to 1900hrs), nodal pickup and drop will be considered. Residential pickup and drop will be considered for the shift operation (1901hrs to 0600hrs). Residential pickup/drop will be done only at the address mentioned in HR data.

question: Submit option is not available in Timesheet?
answer:
**Submit Option Unavailability in Timesheet**

If the submit option is not available in your timesheet, it could be due to the following reasons:

1. **Timesheet Closure**: Timesheets are closed regularly. For instance, timesheets of CW1 are closed on Monday of CW3, and timesheets of CW2 are closed on Monday of CW4. Once the timesheet is closed, both the "Save" and "Turn in final timesheet" options will be disabled .

2. **Approval Process**: If your timesheet has already been submitted or approved, you will not be able to submit it again until the timesheet period is reopened .

3. **System Issues**: If you are facing any technical issues, it is advisable to raise a [Service-now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the necessary details, such as your project ID and relevant screenshots .

For further assistance, you may want to check the specific timesheet guidelines or contact your timesheet manager.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. How can I recall a submitted timesheet if needed?
2. What steps should I take if my timesheet is rejected?
3. Are there any specific deadlines for submitting timesheets?

Ensure that you are marked as Status manager/ Timesheet manager by the team member   3\. If any updates to the role in PROMISE is done it will take one day to reflect in PRIME   4\. Please refer this video [ link]( https://tube.video.bosch.com/media/t/0_usmdc05o)on Approval of task / Timesheet   5\. Please raise an [ Service-now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the below details:   * Project id    * Project name    * Relevant screenshot    * Role in PROMISE    

Question 164) How to link subproject in Microsoft Project Professional?  
Answer: If you want to link subproject in Microsoft Project Professional then it is mandatory to use these below fields:   • RB_Project_Hierarchy_Indicator - Here you need to select Sizeable / Non- Sizeable Sub-Project option from dropdown   • RB_Project_Hierarchy_ID - You need to enter unique values in the format "ProjectID_xxx", as defined in PROMISE    

Question 165) How can I edit timesheet after turning in final timesheet in PRIME?  
Answer: You can recall the timesheet using the "Recall" option available in the timesheet.

Question 818) Though the actual work is available, phase wise effort is appearing blank.  
Answer: Please check if there are any existing filters in the timesheet entry screen under "Options" menu. If there are any filters available, remove the filters by setting "no filter" option and check if the task is appearing. If there are no filters and still the task does not appear, please raise an [ Service- now](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) ticket with the below details:   1\. Project id   2\. Relevant Screenshot  

Question 819) The effort entered by associates is 0 hrs, then in summary tasks of the Microsoft Project Professional file the actual finish date is updating as NA.  
Answer: Please follow the below steps to ensure that Actual Finish date gets updated properly. Please note that these steps have to be performed on child tasks only.   1\. Insert the columns "Remaining Work", "Remaining Duration" and "% Complete"   2\. For the completed tasks, set "Remaining Work" = 0.   3\. After 2) is completed, "Remaining Duration" may automatically become "0". Else, set it to "0".   4\. After 3) is completed, "% Complete" may become automatically "100%". If it is shown as "0%" or "99%", set it manually to "100%".   Once this is done for all the child tasks, the "Actual Finish" of the summary task will get populated.  

Question 820) Can the closed timesheet be reopened for submission?  
Answer: If timesheet period is closed then it is possible to regularize the efforts by applying Efforts Not Booked (ENB) leave type in ESS. For the days on which you have worked but could not submit timesheet, you can use this option after 1 week from the Timesheet Closure Date in PRIME.

question: How to use PRIME application as my user id is migrated to Germany?
answer:
**Using PRIME Application After User ID Migration to Germany**

If your user ID has been migrated to Germany and you are unable to access the PRIME application, follow these steps:

1. **Check Network Access**: Ensure that you are within the Bosch Global Network. If you are not, you will not be able to access the PRIME application.

2. **Raise a Service-Now Ticket**: If you are within the Bosch Global Network and still facing issues, you should raise a [Service-Now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the following details:
   - Employee number
   - NT/User ID
   - Current domain

This will help the support team address your access issues effectively.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What are the common issues faced after migrating to a new user ID?
2. How long does it typically take to resolve access issues through Service-Now?
3. Are there any specific features in PRIME that I should be aware of after migration?

Question 965) My approval Manager informed that due to some technical issues she can't approve the submitted timesheet. Please suggest.  
Answer: If timesheet is submitted for approval and timesheet period is closed without approval then it is not required to apply the ENB because the submitted actual efforts will transfer to all the required systems i.e. SAP HR CORE, Billing system, etc.  

Question 966) Not able to view the submitted risks in the Project Status Report?  
Answer: Please be informed that if the submitted Risks are not reflecting in the Project Status Report then perform the below steps:   1) Check when was the recent Risks submitted.   2) Check the 'Risk repository' section if the active risks are available in PROMISE. The same will reflect in Prime - Project Status Report Note:   Risks can be removed in PRIME (if any of them is not required). However, once removed, the same cannot be revoked.  

Question 967) Where can I find PRIME help?  
Answer: Please navigate to PRIME Help Dashboard via:   PRIME 3.0- > Other Utilities & Help -> Help Dashboard

Question 969) How to apply for PRIME license?  
Answer: PRIME license can be obtained by an associate who is assigned the role of a PM/Proxy PM of an in-progress project in PROMISE. For more details please go through the procedure document for PRIME license as given in the [ link]( https://connect.bosch.com/communities/service/html/communityview?communityUuid=3f2b43cf-458c-4978-8666-90298eb5a1a8#fullpageWidgetId=Wf88e4d18456a_47fc_bc11_18aaf1492c23&file=c0c89bfa-a9af-4ceb-9302-30233457a34f)and follow the steps defined in containing document. question: Not able to open Timesheet?
answer:
**Unable to Open Timesheet**

If you are unable to open your timesheet, it may be due to the following reasons:

1. **Timesheet Closure**: Timesheets are closed regularly. For example, timesheets of CW1 are closed on Monday of CW3, and those of CW2 are closed on Monday of CW4. Once a timesheet is closed, both the "Save" and "Turn in final timesheet" options will be disabled .

2. **Network Access**: Ensure that you are connected to the Bosch Global Network. If you are not within this network, you will not be able to access the timesheet .

3. **Technical Issues**: If you are within the Bosch Global Network and still cannot access the timesheet, it is advisable to raise a [Service-Now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the following details:
   - Employee number
   - NT/User ID
   - Screenshot of the error message obtained .

For further assistance, please follow the steps mentioned above.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What should I do if my timesheet is showing an error message?
2. How can I check the status of my timesheet submission?
3. Are there specific deadlines for submitting timesheets that I should be aware of?

Question 51) I could not open my .Microsoft Project Professional file. It was hanging for long time and shows as error "client : Loading the request into Soapreader failed.  
Answer: Before you open the actual project schedule file:   1\. Make sure that the latest add-in is installed in your system/laptop.   2\. Clear the cash by using these below steps-   File -> Option -> Project Options -> Save -> Clean up Cache -> Remove from cache   3\. Once the cache cleared then you can open your project schedule file by using these below steps-   File -> Open -> Server Name(e.g. PRIME 3.0) ->Browse -> Show me the list of all projects ->select your project schedule file and open the same(read /write mode)   If still you're facing the same issue then please raise an [ Service- now](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) ticket with appropriate details(Project ID, Project schedule file and snapshot/video clip if any error message)

For more details please Click [ here]( https://tube.video.bosch.com/playlist/dedicated/2109/0_8m0cd2jm/0_xp4t01p3).   Revised submitted effort will be considered for attendance. If the timesheet period is closed, you can regularize attendance by applying “ENB” (Effort not Booked) in Attendance and Leave Management System.   Steps to apply for “ENB” are:   1\. question: I am facing problem in opening Prime from customer location
answer:
**Unable to Open PRIME from Customer Location**

If you are facing issues opening the PRIME application from a customer location, consider the following:

1. **Network Access**: Ensure that you are connected to the Bosch Global Network. If you are not within this network, you will not be able to access the PRIME application.

2. **Technical Issues**: If you are within the Bosch Global Network and still cannot access PRIME, it is advisable to raise a [Service-Now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the following details:
   - Employee number
   - NT/User ID
   - Current domain

This will help the support team address your access issues effectively.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What should I do if I encounter an error message when trying to access PRIME?
2. Are there specific requirements for accessing PRIME from different locations?
3. How long does it typically take to resolve access issues through Service-Now?

question: Save button is not enabled in Timesheet?
answer:
**Save Button Not Enabled in Timesheet**

If the save button is not enabled in your timesheet, it may be due to the following reasons:

1. **Timesheet Closure**: Timesheets are closed regularly. For instance, timesheets of CW1 are closed on Monday of CW3, and those of CW2 are closed on Monday of CW4. Once a timesheet is closed, both the "Save" and "Turn in final timesheet" options will be disabled .

2. **Technical Issues**: If you believe the timesheet should be open and the save button is still disabled, it is advisable to raise a [Service-Now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the following details:
   - Employee number
   - NT/User ID
   - Screenshot of the error message obtained .

For further assistance, please follow the steps mentioned above.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What should I do if my timesheet is showing an error message?
2. How can I check the status of my timesheet submission?
3. Are there specific deadlines for submitting timesheets that I should be aware of?

Question 474) Why am I not able to approve my team mates timesheet. Project 2016 is giving an error?  
Answer: Please perform the below checks:   1.Acccess to Project 2016 and Approvals screen is given to the PM/Proxy PM's of a project.   2.Ensure that you are marked as Status manager/ Timesheet manager by the team member.   3.If any updates to the role in PROMISE is done it will take one day to reflect in PRIME.   4.Please raise an [ Service-now](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) ticket with the below details:   a. Question 476) I am not able to submit metrics as the Save button is disabled?  
Answer: Project metrics can be edited only by Project Manager (PM) / proxy PM of the project/subproject. Please check if you are assigned as PM / proxy PM of the project/subproject in PROMISE. question: Why is Data Analysis Report not getting generating?
answer:
**Issues with Generating Data Analysis Report (DAR)**

If you are facing issues with generating the Data Analysis Report (DAR), consider the following tips to resolve the problem:

1. **Project Applicability**: Ensure that the project is applicable for the Data Analysis Report (DAR).

2. **Latest Computation Date**: Check the latest computation date to confirm that the data is up-to-date.

3. **MPP File Publication**: Verify if the MPP file was published with the actual work included.

4. **Daily Computation Success**: Ensure that the daily computation has been 100% successful.

5. **Last Published Date**: Check the last published date and wait for 24 hours before attempting to generate the report again.

6. **Quarter of Report Generation**: Confirm which quarter the report is being generated for, as this may affect the data availability.

If task approvals have occurred on the same day, they will not reflect in the DAR report immediately. You should first publish the project schedule file and then refer to the DAR report the following day for the effort information to be reflected. Additionally, if the task spans multiple months, the report data will also span across those months.

If the issue persists, please raise a [Service-Now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the following details:
- Project ID
- Project Name

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What are the common reasons for discrepancies in the DAR report?
2. How can I check the status of my project to ensure it is eligible for a DAR?
3. Are there specific user roles that have access to generate the DAR?

Question 333) While generating Data Analysis Reports for few groups no data is found though the projects are available.  
Answer: If you are facing any issues in the generated DAR report, here are a few tips to resolve it:   1\. Check if the project is applicable for Data Analysis Report (DAR).   2\. Check the latest computation date.   3\. Check if the MPP file was published with the actual work.   4\. Check if the daily computation is already 100% successful.   5\. Check the last published date after 24 hours.   6\. Check for which quarter is the report generated.**   If the task approvals have happened today, it will not reflect in the DAR report immediately. First, publish the project schedule file. Once published, kindly refer the DAR report on the next day for the effort information to get reflected.   Additionally, please check if the task is spanning across multiple months. In such a case, even the report data will be spanning across multiple months.   Please raise an [ Service-now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the below details:   1\. Project ID   2\. Project Name

Question 186) The effort data in Data Analysis Report activity wise Data is mis-matching with Microsoft Project Professional data. How to fix this?  
Answer: If you are facing any issues in the generated DAR report, here are a few tips to resolve it:   1\. Check if the project is applicable for Data Analysis Report (DAR).   2\. Check the latest computation date.   3\. Check if the MPP file was published with the actual work.   4\. Check if the daily computation is already 100% successful.   5\. Check the last published date after 24 hours.   6\. Check for which quarter is the report generated.**   If the task approvals have happened today, it will not reflect in the DAR report immediately. First, publish the project schedule file. Once published, kindly refer the DAR report on the next day for the effort information to get reflected.   Additionally, please check if the task is spanning across multiple months. In such a case, even the report data will be spanning across multiple months.

question: Can the Task rows which are copied by mistake be removed ?
answer:
**Removing Mistakenly Copied Task Rows**

If you have copied task rows mistakenly, it is important to note that tasks should not be copied from one file to another or even within the same file. When tasks are copied, the "Actual" values of the old task will also be copied to the new task, which cannot be deleted by the user. 

For further assistance, you can watch this [video](https://tube.video.bosch.com/playlist/dedicated/2109/0_adkvzp4m/0_duw43cwe) for more details on handling copied tasks.

If you need additional support, please raise a [Service-Now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the following details:
- Project ID
- Project Name
- Relevant snapshot of the issue

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What steps should I take if I accidentally copy the wrong task data?
2. Are there any best practices for managing tasks in Microsoft Project Professional?
3. How can I prevent copying errors in the future when working with task rows?

Question 1083) Why am I not able to copy the tasks in Microsoft Project Professional file?  
Answer: When you are copying tasks within a mpp file, please copy only the required cells like Task Name, Activity Code etc. You should not be copying the columns with Actuals - like Actual Start, Actual Finish, Actual Work etc. Similarly, do not copy the entire task row and paste. This will result in Actuals getting copied and pasted. Once Actuals are pasted, you will not be able to remove the same.   If you are copying from excel, please ensure that you copy the correct cells from excel and paste the same in the right cells of mpp. In case of mismatch in formats or data types, the data will not get copied.

question: Will my timesheet go for an approval to my Manager?
answer:
**Timesheet Approval Process**

Yes, your timesheet will go for approval to your manager. Timesheets are approved by the associate who is configured as your timesheet manager. You can set or check your timesheet manager in the "Set My Timesheet Manager" option available [here](https://bgsw-primepha.apac.bosch.com/PRIMECustomReports/Areas/My%20Timesheet%20Manager/MyTimesheetManager.aspx?instance=RBEI). 

Typically, the Project Manager (PM), proxy PM, or reporting manager is configured as the timesheet manager for associates. If the PM or proxy PM sets themselves as the timesheet manager, the timesheets will be automatically approved upon submission.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. How can I check the status of my submitted timesheet?
2. What should I do if my timesheet is not approved by my manager?
3. Are there specific criteria for my manager to approve my timesheet?

context.content:
Please raise an [ Service-now](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) ticket with the below details:   1\. Project ID   2\. Project name   3\. Relevant snapshot  

Question 28) Finding difficulties in submitting the timesheet.  
Answer: You can refer [Timesheet Entry and Submission video](https://tube.video.bosch.com/playlist/dedicated/2109/0_8m0cd2jm/0_ojs7vzg4) [Additional tips on timesheet submission](https://tube.video.bosch.com/playlist/dedicated/2109/0_8m0cd2jm/0_xp4t01p3) which has all the required information on timesheet entry and submission details.  

Question 29) Will my timesheet go for an approval to my Manager?  
Answer: Timesheets are approved by associate who is configured as your timesheet manager in "Set My Timesheet Manager" option available as per this [ link](https://bgsw-primepha.apac.bosch.com/PRIMECustomReports/Areas/My%20Timesheet%20Manager/MyTimesheetManager.aspx?instance=RBEI).   Generally, PM / proxy PM / reporting manager is configured as the timesheet manager of associates. PMs / proxy PMs can set themselves as timesheet managers, which means timesheets will get automatically approved upon submission.  

Question 30) Why is the effort of an approved timesheet reflecting only in the Microsoft Project Professional file?  
Answer: This could happen in the following scenario.   1\. Consider that an associate has submitted the timesheet. Once the tasks are approved by the manager, the effort will get updated in the mpp file.   After this, if associate recalls the timesheet and doesn’t re-submit the same before the timesheet period is closed, this may result in the mismatch. The approved effort will be available in mpp file. However, as timesheet has not been re-submitted, the effort considered for attendance is 0. 2.Please refer the "Effort data for BEST report" in PRIME to track the submitted/approved hours from timesheet. Any updates in the timesheet today will reflect in the BEST report the next day.

Question 163) The submitted timesheet is not approved as my manager does not have access to approvals.  
Answer: Below are the required criteria to approve the timesheet:   1\. Access to Project Professional and Approvals screen is given to the PM/Proxy PM's of a project.   2\. Ensure that you are marked as Status manager/ Timesheet manager by the team member   3\. If any updates to the role in PROMISE is done it will take one day to reflect in PRIME   4\. Please refer this video [ link]( https://tube.video.bosch.com/media/t/0_usmdc05o)on Approval of task / Timesheet   5\. Please raise an [ Service-now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the below details:   * Project id    * Project name    * Relevant screenshot    * Role in PROMISE    

Question 164) How to link subproject in Microsoft Project Professional?  
Answer: If you want to link subproject in Microsoft Project Professional then it is mandatory to use these below fields:   • RB_Project_Hierarchy_Indicator - Here you need to select Sizeable / Non- Sizeable Sub-Project option from dropdown   • RB_Project_Hierarchy_ID - You need to enter unique values in the format "ProjectID_xxx", as defined in PROMISE    

Question 165) How can I edit timesheet after turning in final timesheet in PRIME?  
Answer: You can recall the timesheet using the "Recall" option available in the timesheet.

Question 247) The effort of an approved timesheet is not visible, but it is available in Microsoft Project Professional?  
Answer: This could happen in the following scenario.   1\. Consider that an associate has submitted the timesheet. Once the tasks are approved by the manager, the effort will get updated in the mpp file.   After this, if associate recalls the timesheet and doesn’t re-submit the same before the timesheet period is closed, this may result in the mismatch. The approved effort will be available in mpp file. However, as timesheet has not been re-submitted, the effort considered for attendance is 0. 2.Please refer the "Effort data for BEST report" in PRIME to track the submitted/approved hours from timesheet. Any updates in the timesheet today will reflect in the BEST report the next day.   Refer the columns submitted / Approved project efforts and approved Non project efforts based on Monthly / Day-wise view.   If the effort is available in the report, then Please raise an [ Service-now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items)

question: How to reject timesheet in PRIME?
answer:
**Rejecting Timesheet in PRIME**

To reject a timesheet in PRIME, follow these steps:

1. **Access the Timesheet Approval Screen**: The timesheet can be rejected by the Timesheet Manager using the "Reject" option available in the [timesheet approval screen](https://inside-prime.bosch.com/PWA/RBEI/Approvals.aspx).

2. **Recall Option**: Alternatively, the associate can directly recall the timesheet using the "Recall" option available in the timesheet.

3. **Refer to Video**: For detailed steps on recalling a timesheet, you can refer to the [Timesheet Recall steps video](https://tube.video.bosch.com/playlist/dedicated/2109/0_8m0cd2jm/0_xp4t01p3).

If you need further assistance, please raise a [Service-Now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the relevant details.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What happens after I reject a timesheet?
2. Can I modify a timesheet after it has been submitted for approval?
3. How can I check the status of my rejected timesheet?

Question 89) How to delete tasks in PRIME?  
Answer: It is not possible to remove a task from the timesheet. However, you can make the task stop appearing in the timesheet from subsequent weeks. In order to do this, open the timesheet. In the left side pane, you will find a column named "Remaining Work". For all the tasks which need to be stopped from appearing from future weeks, set "Remaining Work" to "0".

question: Review Defect Leakage?
answer:
**Review Defect Leakage**

Review Defect Leakage is a metric used to measure the effectiveness of the review process in software development. It quantifies the total number of defects that escape the review phase and are found in later stages of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). 

The formula for calculating Review Defect Leakage (RDL) is:

\[ 
RDL = \frac{(TD + DD)}{(TD + DD + RD)} \times 100 
\]

Where:
- **TD** = Test defects
- **DD** = Delivered defects
- **RD** = Review defects

This metric helps in understanding how many defects were not caught during the review phase and were instead found later, indicating the effectiveness of the review process .

For a detailed understanding of Review Defect Leakage, you can refer to this [link](https://kor2vm0022.apac.bosch.com/stages/#/workspace/4300/_vv/process/guidance/_p4xE0K2ftQm5GpIOgXHzvA) .

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. How can we improve Review Defect Leakage in our projects?
2. What are the common causes of defects leaking through the review process?
3. Are there specific tools or practices recommended for effective defect review?

Value is entered as 428714, but the required value is 00000428714 (with leading zeros).   Additionally, please verify whether the MCR ID is present in the data which is flowing from MCR to RBEI systems.

question: Not able to generate Effort data for best Report in PRIME.
answer:
**Generating Effort Data for BEST Report in PRIME**

If you are having issues generating the Effort Data for the BEST report in PRIME, you can try the following steps:

1. **Browser Check**: Open the page in an alternate browser to see if the issue persists.

2. **Permissions**: Ensure that you have the necessary permissions to access the report. Your role should be Team Member, Proxy PM, or PM in PROMISE.

3. **Role Verification**: Double-check your role in the system to confirm it aligns with the access requirements.

If you continue to face issues after trying these steps, please raise a [Service-now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the following details:
- Employee Number
- Project ID

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What specific error message are you encountering when trying to generate the report?
2. Are there any recent changes in your role or permissions that might affect your access?
3. How often should I check for updates in the BEST report after submitting my timesheet?

question: What is the purpose of resource tagging?
answer:
**Purpose of Resource Tagging**

Resource tagging is essential for describing the skillsets and skills of associates within the Planisware tool. The primary purposes of resource tagging include:

1. **Skill Identification**: It helps in identifying the specific skills and competencies of associates, making it easier for managers to find the right resources for projects based on required skillsets .

2. **Resource Allocation**: By tagging resources with relevant skills, it ensures that associates are assigned to projects where they can effectively contribute, thereby optimizing resource allocation .

3. **Search Efficiency**: When BGSW Managers search for resources with particular skillsets, tagging allows for a more efficient and accurate search process, ensuring that the right talent is matched to the right tasks .

4. **Project Suitability**: Tagging associates with applicable skills ensures that they are capable of working on assigned projects, enhancing overall project success .

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. How can I tag skills to an associate in Planisware?
2. What are the consequences of not tagging resources correctly?
3. Can I change or update the skillsets of an associate after they have been tagged?

question: Can a work package be deleted
answer:
**Deleting a Work Package**

Work packages cannot be deleted from your end in the system. If you need to delete a work package, you must raise a ticket in iQuery with all relevant details. 

For further assistance, please ensure to include the following information in your ticket:
- Work package name
- Any additional context or details that may help in processing your request

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What steps should I follow to raise a ticket in iQuery?
2. Are there any alternatives to deleting a work package if it's no longer needed?
3. How long does it typically take to process a deletion request for a work package?

context.content:
Question 34) How to delete a work package?  
Answer: Please note that the work packages cannot be deleted from your end. Please raise a ticket in iQuery with all relevant details.  

Question 35) I am unable to see the resources.  
Answer: Please check if there are any filters applied. You can find the filter option in the top right corner. If yes, then please remove it and set the RBS value to BGSW.  

Question 36) What is the procedure to delete a work package?  
Answer: Please note that the work packages cannot be deleted from your end. Please raise a ticket in iQuery with all relevant details.  

Question 37) How do allocate resources for the previous month?  
Answer: Please be informed that the past month's allocation cannot be done in Planisware. Please raise a ticket in iQuery with all relevant details which will be taken to the billing team for backend update.  

Question 38) Can past month allocation be done in Planisware?  
Answer: Please be informed that the past month's allocation cannot be done in Planisware. Please raise a ticket in iQuery with all relevant details which will be taken to the billing team for backend update.  

Question 39) Why is the supplier unable to see the demand?  
Answer: Please note that there could be filters applied because of which the demands are not listed by default. Please ask the supplier to remove any filter applied. The filter option can be seen in the top right corner.  

Question 40) I am unable to Publish a demand.  
Answer: Please create an iQuery ticket with an error screenshot.  

Question 41) How to extend the work package?  
Answer: Please create an iQuery ticket with the work package name.  

Question 42) How to add a primary skillset?  
Answer: Please watch the 'BGSW Planisware - Viewing all resources and editing skillset of resources' video from the below link to understand how to Map the primary skillset.  [https://rb-boschlearningspace.bosch.com/accelerator/dispatch.do?node=17664&preview=false]

If still not appearing then raise an [ Service- now](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) ticket for same with appropriate details like:   \- Project ID   \- Schedule file name   \- snapshots if any    

Question 86) Unable to access Projects link in PRIME.  
Answer: Be notified about some important information to access Projects dashboard in PWA:   1) Approvals in PRIME are generally accessible by PMs and proxy PMs.   2) If any updates on role is done in the PROMISE today then it will reflect in PRIME the next day. After which you will be able to access the Projects.   3) Ensure that you are marked as a Status Manager / Timesheet Manager for your team member.  

Question 87) Where can I find project effort?  
Answer: To check both the project and non-project effort entered by associates, refer the [ link](https://app.powerbi.com/reportEmbed?reportId=f6967fb1-0edc-46bc-9eb0-25177cb681f0&autoAuth=true&ctid=0ae51e19-07c8-4e4b-bb6d-648ee58410f4) on effort dashboard.   Please note that this report is accessible only by project manages and above.  

Question 88) How to fix Microsoft Project Professional publish failure error?  
Answer: On some rare occasions, the project publish gets failed due to an unforeseen issue in server. Publish the project file again and it will be successful.   Status of publish can be checked in [ My Queued Jobs ](https://bgsw-prime.apac.bosch.com/PWA/RBEI/MyJobs.aspx).  

Question 89) How to delete tasks in PRIME?  
Answer: It is not possible to remove a task from the timesheet. However, you can make the task stop appearing in the timesheet from subsequent weeks. In order to do this, open the timesheet. In the left side pane, you will find a column named "Remaining Work". For all the tasks which need to be stopped from appearing from future weeks, set "Remaining Work" to "0".

context.content:
Answer: Project/ Project Work once created in PROMISE cannot be deleted or canceled.   But, if all the approvers have not approved, then it will not be considered as a valid project and will not be considered for the Operational Excellence Index (OEI).   Note: Projects in 'Created' and 'Saved' state can be left as it is.  

Question 1147) How to delete a project work in PROMISE?  
Answer: Project/ Project Work once created in PROMISE cannot be deleted or canceled.   But, if all the approvers have not approved, then it will not be considered as a valid project and will not be considered for the Operational Excellence Index (OEI).   Note: Projects in 'Created' and 'Saved' state can be left as it is.  

Question 1148) How to delete a project in PROMISE?  
Answer: Project/ Project Work once created in PROMISE cannot be deleted or canceled.   But, if all the approvers have not approved, then it will not be considered as a valid project and will not be considered for the Operational Excellence Index (OEI).   Note: Projects in 'Created' and 'Saved' state can be left as it is.  

Question 1149) Can a sub project be deleted or renamed from PROMISE?  
Answer: Projects once created in PROMISE certainly cannot be deleted.   1) The Sub Project ID cannot be changed but the Sub Project name can be changed by the Project Manager (PM).   2) Sub Projects can be withdrawn using the "Withdraw" button by the PM or Sub Project Initiator before the Sub Project is forwarded to the Org Manager for Staffing Model update.   3) The Sub Project closure can be initiated by the Project Manager (PM) using the Project Closure Form (PCF) option.   For Sub Project closure navigate to Sub Project --> Profile --> Closure --> New PCF  

Question 1150) Can a sub project work be deleted or renamed from PROMISE?  
Answer: Projects once created in PROMISE certainly cannot be deleted.   1) The Sub Project ID cannot be changed but the Sub Project name can be changed by the Project Manager (PM).

Question 91) Admin tasks are not listed?  
Answer: The following 3 non-projects are displayed by default in every timesheet - "Organization Activities", "Training / Competency Development", "Waiting for Task Allocation".   In case any further activity needs to be added, option "Timesheet > Add Row > Add Non-Project Line" needs to be selected.   Once the task is selected, the same will be available for effort entry within the timesheet. Once a non-project task is added, this will be available in all the timesheets of the subsequent weeks.

question: What is the use of My Projects in Planisware?
answer:
**Use of My Projects in Planisware**

The "My Projects" feature in Planisware allows users to view and manage projects that are specifically assigned to their group or line. Here are the key uses:

1. **Project Overview**: Users can see all the projects they are directly involved in, providing a clear overview of their responsibilities.

2. **Access to Details**: It enables users to select a particular project to view detailed information, facilitating better management and tracking of project progress.

3. **Resource Management**: By focusing on their projects, users can effectively manage resources and tasks associated with those projects, ensuring that all aspects are aligned with project goals.

This feature enhances project visibility and helps in efficient project management within the Planisware tool.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. How can I access the "My Projects" section in Planisware?
2. Are there any specific permissions required to view projects in "My Projects"?
3. Can I customize the view of my projects in Planisware?

Answer: Advance Payment is applicable for Fixed Price project only. Fixed Price projects will be driven with billing milestones, hence advance payments can be included as billing milestones in Bill Plan  

Question 55) How are external resources handled in revamped O2I scenario?  
Answer: Allocation of external resources is handled in Planisware and the same data flows into the new cockpit created as part of O2I revamp. Basically, In Planisware, type 83 will be treated the same as internal resources and 84 which is work package based, PMO equivalent of the work package value should be entered. For more information, please refer to Planiswaare FAQ  

Question 56) Whether ICT continues to be the tool used for resource transfer, once Planisware comes into picture?  
Answer: Resource based cost transfer will cease to exist in ICT effective 31st May 2020. Planisware will be used for resource cost transfer from 1st of June.

question: Can I retract or delete a published demand?
answer:
**Retracting or Deleting a Published Demand**

To retract or delete a published demand, you need to create an iQuery ticket with all the relevant details. This process ensures that your request is properly documented and handled by the appropriate team.

Make sure to include the following information in your ticket:
- Demand name
- Reason for retraction or deletion
- Any additional context that may assist in processing your request

This approach allows for a systematic review and action regarding your demand.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What information should I include in the iQuery ticket for retracting a demand?
2. Are there any specific guidelines or restrictions for retracting a published demand?
3. How long does it typically take to process a request for retracting or deleting a demand?

question: How to check the current allocation status of a resource?
answer:
**Checking the Current Allocation Status of a Resource**

To check the current allocation status of a resource in Planisware, you can follow these steps:

1. **Access the Resource Allocation Report**: Navigate to the relevant section in Planisware where resource allocations are displayed.

2. **Filter Options**: Ensure that no filters are applied that might restrict the visibility of the resource allocations. You can find the filter option in the top right corner of the interface.

3. **Review the Report**: Look for the specific resource in the report to see its current allocation status.

If you encounter any issues or if the resource is not visible, you may need to raise an iQuery ticket with the relevant details.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What specific details should I include in the iQuery ticket if I can't find the resource?
2. Are there any common issues that might prevent a resource from showing up in the allocation report?
3. Can I customize the view of the resource allocation report in Planisware?

answer:
**Viewing Multiple Groups/Projects in the Dashboard**

To see multiple groups or projects in the Planisware dashboard, follow these steps:

1. **Navigate to the Projects Section**: Click on the "Projects" tab in the main menu.

2. **Select All Projects**: Choose the "All Projects" option to view a comprehensive list of all projects available.

3. **Filter by Group**: If you want to see projects from specific groups, you can apply filters to narrow down the list based on your requirements.

4. **Dashboard Customization**: Depending on your access level, you may also have options to customize your dashboard to display projects from multiple groups simultaneously.

If you encounter any issues or if certain projects are not visible, consider raising an iQuery ticket with the relevant details.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. Are there specific permissions required to view projects from multiple groups?
2. Can I save my filtered view for future access in the dashboard?
3. How do I customize the dashboard layout to better suit my needs?

question: How is demand forecast calculated?
answer:
**Demand Forecast Calculation**

Demand forecasting in SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP) involves several key steps and methodologies to ensure accurate predictions. Here’s an overview of the process:

1. **Data Preparation**: 
   - Gather historical sales data and relevant attributes that influence demand, such as seasonality, promotions, and market trends .

2. **Statistical Forecasting**:
   - Utilize statistical methods to analyze historical data. This includes techniques like time series analysis, which helps in identifying patterns and trends over time .

3. **Forecast Models**:
   - Implement various forecasting models, such as base forecasts, consensus forecasts, and statistical forecasting runs. These models help in generating initial forecasts based on historical data .

4. **Forecast Error Analysis**:
   - Evaluate the accuracy of forecasts by analyzing forecast errors. This step is crucial for refining the forecasting process and improving future predictions .

5. **Collaboration and Consensus**:
   - Engage stakeholders in the forecasting process to adjust forecasts based on insights from sales, marketing, and other relevant departments. This collaborative approach helps in aligning forecasts with business realities .

6. **Demand Sensing**:
   - Implement demand sensing techniques to adjust forecasts based on real-time data and short-term changes in demand patterns .

7. **Finalization**:
   - After considering all inputs and adjustments, finalize the demand forecast for use in planning and decision-making processes .

This structured approach ensures that demand forecasts are not only based on historical data but also incorporate current market dynamics and collaborative insights.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What specific statistical methods are commonly used in demand forecasting?
2. How can I improve the accuracy of my demand forecasts?
3. What tools or software can assist in the demand forecasting process?

context.content:
Some have reported that Agile methodologies, including test-driven 
development, result in higher levels of quality being delivered for testing.  
 
Estimation can be done either bottom-up or top-down. Techniques which can be used in test 
estimation, singly or in combination, include the following: 

 Intuition, guesses, and past experience 

 Work Breakdown Structures (WBS) 

 Team estimation sessions (e.g., Wide Band Delphi) 

 Company standards and norms 

 Percentages of the overall project effort or staffing levels (e.g., tester-developer ratios) 

 Organizational history and metrics, including metrics-derived models that estimate the number 
of defects, the number of test cycles, the number of test cases, each test's average effort, and 
the number of regression cycles involved 

 Industry averages and predictive models such as function points, lines of code, estimated 
developer effort, or other project parameters (e.g., see [Jones07]).  

 



Certified Tester 
Advanced Level Syllabus - Test Manager 

International 
Software Testing 

Qualifications Board 
  

 

Version 2012 Page 38 of 82 19 October 2012 

© International Software Testing Qualifications Board 

 

In most cases, the estimate, once prepared, must be delivered to management, along with a 
justification (see Section 2.7). Frequently, some negotiation ensues, often resulting in a reworking of 
the estimate. Ideally, the final test estimate represents the best-possible balance of organizational and 
project goals in the areas of quality, schedule, budget, and features.  
 
It is important to remember that any estimate is based on the information available at the time it was 
prepared.  Early in a project, the information may be quite limited.  In addition, information that is 
available early in a project may change over time.  In order to remain accurate, estimates should be 
updated to reflect new and changed information.  

2.6 Defining and Using Test Metrics 

A management cliché says that what gets measured gets done.

context.content:
What is SAFe Product Owner & Product Manager? 

The SAFe® Product Owner and SAFe® Product Manager (POPM) course covers the tactical 
responsibilities of these roles in the Agile Release Train (ART). The course and resulting certification 
give you the guidance and tools to work effectively in remote environments with distributed teams. 

Learn how product owners and product managers should work together to achieve the best 
possible customer and business outcomes. The SAFe POPM course will teach you how to adopt a 
customer-centric approach to building products, using the SAFe® to deliver more value, faster. 
Topics covered in this course include the daily role of POs and PMs; collaborating with engineering 
teams and business stakeholders; how to write epics, features, and stories; and how to design, 
prioritize, build, test, and deliver products with increased productivity and higher quality.  
 

Course Content 

• Explore PO and PM Roles and Responsibilities 

• Preparing for PI Planning 

• Leading PI Planning  

• Executing Iterations 

• Executing the PI  
 

 

Who should attend? 
Product Managers, Product Owners, Business Analysts 

Attendees learn: 
• How to perform the role of a PO and a PM on a daily basis 
• How to put the customer at the center of your design, build, and test process 
• How to prepare for and lead PI Planning 
• How to decompose Epics to Features and Features to Stories 
• How to collaborate with Agile teams to forecast work 

What’s included: 
• Course workbook and SAFe Studio access to help you prepare to take the certification exam, 

claim your digital badge, and tools to get started in your SAFe role 

• Remote learning via SAFe® Virtual Classrooms 

• One-year membership to SAFe Studio with your first-class attendance   
o Product Management Video playlist and customer research tools to support product owners in 

their role 
o Platform access to e-learning modules and curated members-only content to support your SAFe 

transformation

question: How to view historical demand data?
answer:
**Viewing Historical Demand Data**

To view historical demand data in Planisware, you can follow these steps:

1. **Access the Demand Reports**: Navigate to the reports section within Planisware where demand data is stored.

2. **Select Historical Data**: Look for options that allow you to filter or select historical demand data. This may include specific time frames or categories of demand.

3. **Utilize Filters**: Apply any necessary filters to narrow down the data to the specific historical periods or projects you are interested in.

4. **Generate the Report**: Once you have set your filters, generate the report to view the historical demand data.

If you encounter any issues or if the historical data is not visible, consider creating an iQuery ticket with the relevant details for further assistance.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What specific filters can I use to refine my search for historical demand data?
2. Are there any common issues that might prevent access to historical demand data?
3. Can I export the historical demand data for further analysis?

Question 108) The prime utilities is missing, I can not publish my Microsoft Project Professional?  
Answer: The following activities are to be ensured by Project Managers (PM) / Proxy PMs.   1.Check if the latest Addin is installed   2\. question: What should I do if I am tagged to the wrong skillset?
answer:
**Steps to Take if Tagged to the Wrong Skillset**

If you find yourself tagged to the wrong skillset in Planisware, you should follow these steps:

1. **Contact Your Resource Manager**: Reach out to your Resource Manager or Competency Lead, as they are responsible for managing skillsets and can assist in correcting any errors.

2. **Provide Details**: When contacting your manager, provide specific details about the incorrect skillset and the correct skillset you believe should be assigned to you.

3. **Follow Up**: If the issue is not resolved promptly, consider following up with your manager to ensure that the necessary changes are made.

4. **Raise an iQuery Ticket**: If you are unable to resolve the issue through your Resource Manager, you may need to create an iQuery ticket with all the required details for further assistance.

By following these steps, you can ensure that your skillset is accurately reflected in the system.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. How long does it typically take to update a skillset in Planisware?
2. What information should I include in the iQuery ticket for skillset issues?
3. Can I view my current skillset assignments in Planisware?

context.content:
will be motivated to increase their skills and knowledge so they will be ready for the next opportunity.  
 
A Test Manager will rarely be able to hire the perfect team members.  And, even if the team members 
are perfect for the current project, they may not be the perfect mix for the next project.  The Test 
Manager should hire people who are intelligent, curious, adaptable, willing to work, able to work 
effectively as part of a team, and willing and able to learn.  Even though that set of perfect individuals 
is probably not available, a strong team can be built by balancing the strengths and weaknesses of the 
individuals.  
 
Using the skills assessment spreadsheet, the Test Manager can identify where the team is strong and 
where it is weak.  This information forms the foundation of a training and skills development plan.  
Starting with the weaknesses that have the greatest impact on the team’s effectiveness and efficiency, 
the Test Manager should decide how to address those areas.  One approach is training, e.g., send 
people to a training course, have training sessions in-house, develop custom training, use e-learning 
courses.  Another approach is self-study, e.g., books, webinars, Internet resources. Yet another 
approach is cross-training, e.g., assigning someone with an interest in learning a skill to work with 
someone who already has the skill on a task requiring that skill, having local experts give brief 
presentations on their area of expertise, etc.  (Mentoring is a similar approach, where a person who is 
new to a role is paired with a senior person who has had that role, and the senior person acts as an 
ongoing resource to provide advice and assistance.)  In addition to addressing weakness, the Test 
Manager should remember to leverage the strengths identified in the skills assessment as part of the 
training and skills development plan.  For more on such test team development plans, see [McKay07]. 

7.3 Test Team Dynamics

question: Can demand be edited once published?
answer:
**Editing Published Demand**

Once demand has been published in Planisware, it cannot be directly edited. If you encounter a situation where you need to make changes to a published demand, you should follow these steps:

1. **Create an iQuery Ticket**: Since editing published demand is not allowed, you will need to raise an iQuery ticket. Include all relevant details about the demand that needs to be edited.

2. **Provide Necessary Information**: In your ticket, make sure to specify the demand ID, the changes required, and any other pertinent information that will help in processing your request.

3. **Await Response**: After submitting your ticket, wait for a response from the support team, who will guide you on the next steps or make the necessary adjustments.

This process ensures that any required changes to published demand are handled appropriately.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What types of changes can be made to demand before it is published?
2. How long does it typically take to process an iQuery ticket for demand changes?
3. Are there any common issues that arise when trying to publish demand?

Question 794) In the Microsoft Project Professional file After publishing not able to see team members' approved timesheets actual effort?  
Answer: In case you have taken over the file from another manager, there could be some approval of tasks which could be still going to the old manager for approval.   To resolve this issue:   1\. Open the project schedule file   2\. Open all the tasks, using the option "View > Outline > All subtasks"   3\. In Gantt chart view -> insert a column -> select Status Manager   4\. Set it to the current manager   5\. Publish the project file   6\. Navigate to "Approvals" option in PRIME PWA. Click [ here ](https://bgsw-prime.apac.bosch.com/PWA/RBEI/Approvals.aspx).   If any tasks are pending for approval, approve the same. If this doesn't solve the issue, then please raise an [ Service-now ](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items)ticket with the below details:   1\. Project id   2\. Project name   3\. Relevant snapshot  

Question 795) How to remove old tasks which is still appearing in Planned effort?  
Answer: Make the Remaining work as "0" for the completed task. These task will not appear in the next week timesheet.  

Question 796) How to resolve the issue as the Precomputation is not changing the values for DDE?  
Answer: The details of delivered defects considered for the month are displayed as a link within DDE metric. Please click on the link and check if there is any discrepancy in the details of defects considered. Please note that Defect Reported Date of the defect is considered when computing DDE metric. Project effort is directly considered from project schedule file. If the project is a Development project, entire project effort gets considered in DDE computation.

question: What reports are available in Planisware?
answer:
**Available Reports in Planisware**

In Planisware, several reports are available to assist users in managing and analyzing data. Here are some key reports you can access:

1. **Project Report**:
   - This report provides detailed insights into project-related data. You can access it by navigating to Reports --> Project Report .

2. **Billing Cube Report**:
   - To obtain the Billing Cube Report, go to Reports --> Project Report. More information can be found on the Bosch Connect page .

3. **Reporting Manager Report**:
   - For consolidated attendance or BEST reports, you can access this report by going to Reports --> Reporting Manager Report. Additional details are available on the Reports wiki page .

4. **Attendance Reports**:
   - These reports provide insights into attendance data flowing from the Integration Hub to the attendance system. You can find more information on how to access these reports in the Reporting Manager Report section .

For further details on specific reports and their functionalities, you may refer to the Bosch Connect wiki pages linked in the responses.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. How can I customize the reports in Planisware to fit my needs?
2. Are there any specific filters I can apply to the reports for better insights?
3. What steps should I take if I encounter issues while generating reports in Planisware?
