question: Not able to open Timesheet?
answer:
**Unable to Open Timesheet**

If you are unable to open your timesheet, it may be due to the following reasons:

1. **Timesheet Closure**: Timesheets are regularly closed. For example, timesheets of CW1 are closed on Monday of CW3, and timesheets of CW2 are closed on Monday of CW4. Once a timesheet is closed, both the "Save" and "Turn in final timesheet" options will be disabled .

2. **Network Access**: Ensure that you are connected to the Bosch Global Network. If you are not within this network, you will not be able to access the timesheet .

3. **Technical Issues**: If you are within the Bosch Global Network and still cannot open the timesheet, it is advisable to raise a [Service-Now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the following details:
   - Employee number
   - NT/User ID
   - Screenshot of the error message obtained .

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What should I do if my timesheet is showing an error message?
2. How can I check if my timesheet period is still open?
3. Are there any specific deadlines for submitting timesheets?

question: I am facing problem in opening Prime from customer location
answer:
**Issues Opening PRIME from Customer Location**

If you are facing problems accessing the PRIME application from a customer location, it may be due to the following reasons:

1. **Network Access**: You may not be within the Bosch Global Network. Access to PRIME is restricted to users connected to this network. If you are outside of it, you will not be able to access the application.

2. **Technical Issues**: If you are within the Bosch Global Network and still cannot access PRIME, it is advisable to raise a [Service-Now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the following details:
   - Employee number
   - NT/User ID
   - Current domain

This will help the support team address your issue effectively.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What should I do if I encounter an error message while trying to access PRIME?
2. Are there specific requirements for accessing PRIME from different locations?
3. How can I check if I am connected to the Bosch Global Network?

question: Save button is not enabled in Timesheet?
answer:
**Save Button Not Enabled in Timesheet**

If the save button is not enabled in your timesheet, it may be due to the following reasons:

1. **Timesheet Closure**: Timesheets are regularly closed. For instance, timesheets of CW1 are closed on Monday of CW3, and timesheets of CW2 are closed on Monday of CW4. Once a timesheet is closed, both the "Save" and "Turn in final timesheet" options will be disabled .

2. **Technical Issues**: If you believe the timesheet should be open and the save button is still disabled, it is advisable to raise a [Service-Now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the following details:
   - Employee number
   - NT/User ID
   - Screenshot of the error message obtained .

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What should I do if my timesheet is showing an error message?
2. How can I check if my timesheet period is still open?
3. Are there any specific deadlines for submitting timesheets?

question: Why is Data Analysis Report not getting generating?
answer:
**Issues with Data Analysis Report Generation**

If you are experiencing issues with the generation of the Data Analysis Report (DAR), consider the following troubleshooting steps:

1. **Project Applicability**: Ensure that the project is applicable for the Data Analysis Report (DAR) .

2. **Computation Date**: Check the latest computation date to confirm that the data is up-to-date .

3. **MPP File Publication**: Verify that the MPP file was published with the actual work included .

4. **Daily Computation Success**: Ensure that the daily computation has been 100% successful .

5. **Last Published Date**: Check the last published date and wait for 24 hours before expecting the data to reflect in the DAR report .

6. **Quarter of Report Generation**: Confirm which quarter the report is being generated for, as this may affect the data availability .

7. **Task Approvals**: If task approvals have occurred on the same day, they will not reflect in the DAR report immediately. You should publish the project schedule file and refer to the DAR report the next day for the effort information to be updated .

If you have checked all these factors and the issue persists, please raise a [Service-Now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the following details:
- Project ID
- Project Name

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What are the common reasons for discrepancies in the Data Analysis Report?
2. How can I check the status of my project to ensure it is eligible for a DAR?
3. Are there specific user roles that can generate the Data Analysis Report?

Question 333) While generating Data Analysis Reports for few groups no data is found though the projects are available.  
Answer: If you are facing any issues in the generated DAR report, here are a few tips to resolve it:   1\. Check if the project is applicable for Data Analysis Report (DAR).   2\. Check the latest computation date.   3\. Check if the MPP file was published with the actual work.   4\. Check if the daily computation is already 100% successful.   5\. Check the last published date after 24 hours.   6\. Check for which quarter is the report generated.**   If the task approvals have happened today, it will not reflect in the DAR report immediately. First, publish the project schedule file. Once published, kindly refer the DAR report on the next day for the effort information to get reflected.   Additionally, please check if the task is spanning across multiple months. In such a case, even the report data will be spanning across multiple months.   Please raise an [ Service-now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the below details:   1\. Project ID   2\. Project Name

question: Can the Task rows which are copied by mistake be removed ?
answer:
**Removing Mistakenly Copied Task Rows**

If you have copied task rows mistakenly in your Microsoft Project Professional file, it is important to note that:

- Tasks should not be copied from one file to another or within the same file. When tasks are copied, the "Actual" values of the old task will also be copied to the new task, which cannot be deleted by the user. 

For further assistance, you can watch this [video](https://tube.video.bosch.com/playlist/dedicated/2109/0_adkvzp4m/0_duw43cwe) for more details on handling copied tasks.

If you need additional support, please raise a [Service-Now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the following details:
- Project ID
- Project Name
- Relevant snapshot of the issue

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What steps should I take if I accidentally copy the wrong task data?
2. Are there any best practices for managing tasks in Microsoft Project Professional?
3. How can I prevent copying errors in the future?

Question 1083) Why am I not able to copy the tasks in Microsoft Project Professional file?  
Answer: When you are copying tasks within a mpp file, please copy only the required cells like Task Name, Activity Code etc. You should not be copying the columns with Actuals - like Actual Start, Actual Finish, Actual Work etc. Similarly, do not copy the entire task row and paste. This will result in Actuals getting copied and pasted. Once Actuals are pasted, you will not be able to remove the same.   If you are copying from excel, please ensure that you copy the correct cells from excel and paste the same in the right cells of mpp. In case of mismatch in formats or data types, the data will not get copied.  

Question 1084) I have issues with PRIME timesheet as the Planned efforts are changing as per the Actual efforts entered?  
Answer: Oh don't worry! This is purely a tool behavior.   The efforts against the 'Actuals' gets automatically updated in 'Planned' field in the MPP file.  

Question 1085) Where can I find project effort in PRIME?

question: Will my timesheet go for an approval to my Manager?
answer:
**Timesheet Approval Process**

Yes, your timesheet will go for approval to your manager. The approval process is managed by the associate who is configured as your timesheet manager. You can set or check your timesheet manager using the "Set My Timesheet Manager" option available [here](https://bgsw-primepha.apac.bosch.com/PRIMECustomReports/Areas/My%20Timesheet%20Manager/MyTimesheetManager.aspx?instance=RBEI). 

Typically, the project manager (PM), proxy PM, or reporting manager is configured as the timesheet manager for associates. If the PM or proxy PM sets themselves as the timesheet manager, the timesheets will be automatically approved upon submission.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. How can I check the status of my submitted timesheet?
2. What should I do if my timesheet is not approved by my manager?
3. Are there specific criteria for a timesheet to be approved?

context.content:
Please raise an [ Service-now](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) ticket with the below details:   1\. Project ID   2\. Project name   3\. Relevant snapshot  

Question 28) Finding difficulties in submitting the timesheet.  
Answer: You can refer [Timesheet Entry and Submission video](https://tube.video.bosch.com/playlist/dedicated/2109/0_8m0cd2jm/0_ojs7vzg4) [Additional tips on timesheet submission](https://tube.video.bosch.com/playlist/dedicated/2109/0_8m0cd2jm/0_xp4t01p3) which has all the required information on timesheet entry and submission details.  

Question 29) Will my timesheet go for an approval to my Manager?  
Answer: Timesheets are approved by associate who is configured as your timesheet manager in "Set My Timesheet Manager" option available as per this [ link](https://bgsw-primepha.apac.bosch.com/PRIMECustomReports/Areas/My%20Timesheet%20Manager/MyTimesheetManager.aspx?instance=RBEI).   Generally, PM / proxy PM / reporting manager is configured as the timesheet manager of associates. PMs / proxy PMs can set themselves as timesheet managers, which means timesheets will get automatically approved upon submission.  

Question 30) Why is the effort of an approved timesheet reflecting only in the Microsoft Project Professional file?  
Answer: This could happen in the following scenario.   1\. Consider that an associate has submitted the timesheet. Once the tasks are approved by the manager, the effort will get updated in the mpp file.   After this, if associate recalls the timesheet and doesn’t re-submit the same before the timesheet period is closed, this may result in the mismatch. The approved effort will be available in mpp file. However, as timesheet has not been re-submitted, the effort considered for attendance is 0. 2.Please refer the "Effort data for BEST report" in PRIME to track the submitted/approved hours from timesheet. Any updates in the timesheet today will reflect in the BEST report the next day.

question: How to reject timesheet in PRIME?
answer:
**Rejecting Timesheet in PRIME**

To reject a timesheet in PRIME, follow these steps:

1. **Access the Timesheet Approval Screen**: The timesheet can be rejected by the Timesheet Manager using the "Reject" option available in the [timesheet approval screen](https://inside-prime.bosch.com/PWA/RBEI/Approvals.aspx).

2. **Recall Option**: Alternatively, the associate can directly recall the timesheet using the "Recall" option available in the timesheet.

3. **Refer to Video**: For detailed steps on recalling a timesheet, you can refer to the [Timesheet Recall steps video](https://tube.video.bosch.com/playlist/dedicated/2109/0_8m0cd2jm/0_xp4t01p3).

If you encounter any issues during this process, consider raising a [Service-Now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) for further assistance.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What happens after a timesheet is rejected?
2. Can I modify my timesheet after it has been submitted for approval?
3. How can I check the status of my timesheet after submission?

context.content:
Please be notified that Effort Not Booked (ENB) option will be enabled after 1 week from the Timesheet Closure Date in PRIME.   If you are facing any technical issue while applying ENB or for further queries, please raise a HR Self Service ticket.

Question 47) I am getting an Invalid RQMS ID error for an old completed task while publishing my project.  
Answer: If the task is an old task which is no longer active, please close the old task by following the below steps.   Please note that these steps have to be performed on child tasks only.   1\. Insert the columns "Remaining Work", "Remaining Duration" and "% Complete"   2\. For the completed tasks, set "Remaining Work" = 0   3\. After 2) is completed, "Remaining Duration" may automatically become "0". Else, set it to "0"   4\. 
aHR0cHM6Ly9iZ3N3aGV5Ym9zY2h0ZXN0MDAxLmJsb2IuY29yZS53aW5kb3dzLm5ldC9oci1wb2xpY3ktdXBkYXRlZC9QcmltZSUyMC0lMjBGQVFzLmRvY3g1
context.title: Prime - FAQs.docx

context.content:
After 3) is completed, "% Complete" may become automatically "100%". If it is shown as "0%" or "99%", set it manually to "100%"   . If it is an on-going task, please check if MCR ID is entered in a wrong format. E.g. Value is entered as 428714, but the required value is 00000428714 (with leading zeros).   Additionally, please verify whether the MCR ID is present in the data which is flowing from MCR to RBEI systems. This info is present in the [ MCR Plan Prime]( https://connect.bosch.com/communities/service/html/communityview?communityUuid=c8f08b91-c255-40cb-97a7-c7cd06620e54#fullpageWidgetId=W78e0275f56ed_45a3_b07b_3a3e37bf7514§ion=files ) link.

question: Review Defect Leakage?
answer:
**Review Defect Leakage**

Review Defect Leakage is a metric used to measure the effectiveness of the review process in software development. It quantifies the total number of defects that escape the review phase and are found in later stages of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). 

The formula for calculating Review Defect Leakage (RDL) is as follows:

\[ 
RDL = \frac{(TD + DD)}{(TD + DD + RD)} \times 100 
\]

Where:
- **TD** = Test defects
- **DD** = Delivered defects
- **RD** = Review defects

This metric helps in understanding how many defects were not caught during the review process and were instead found later, indicating areas for improvement in the review practices.

For a detailed understanding of Review Defect Leakage, you can refer to this [link](https://kor2vm0022.apac.bosch.com/stages/#/workspace/4300/_vv/process/guidance/_p4xE0K2ftQm5GpIOgXHzvA) .

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. How can we improve the Review Defect Leakage rate in our projects?
2. What are the common causes of defects leaking through the review process?
3. Are there specific tools or practices recommended for effective defect review?

question: Not able to generate Effort data for best Report in PRIME.
answer:
**Generating Effort Data for BEST Report in PRIME**

If you are experiencing issues while generating the Effort Data for the BEST report in PRIME, here are some steps you can take to resolve the problem:

1. **Browser Check**: Try opening the page in an alternate browser to see if the issue persists.

2. **Permissions**: Ensure that you have the necessary permissions to access the report. Your role should be Team Member, Proxy PM, or PM in PROMISE.

3. **Role Verification**: Double-check your role in the system to confirm that it aligns with the access requirements.

If you continue to face difficulties after trying these steps, please raise a [Service-now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the following details:
- Employee Number
- Project ID

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What specific error message are you receiving when trying to generate the report?
2. Are there any recent changes in your role or permissions that might affect your access?
3. How often should the Effort Data for BEST report be updated?

Answer: If you are facing any issues in the generated DAR report, here are a few tips to resolve it:   1\. Check if the project is applicable for Data Analysis Report (DAR).   2\. Check the latest computation date.   3\. Check if the MPP file was published with the actual work.   4\. Check if the daily computation is already 100% successful.   5\. Check the last published date after 24 hours.   6\. Check for which quarter is the report generated.**   If the task approvals have happened today, it will not reflect in the DAR report immediately. First, publish the project schedule file. Once published, kindly refer the DAR report on the next day for the effort information to get reflected.   Additionally, please check if the task is spanning across multiple months. In such a case, even the report data will be spanning across multiple months.   Please raise an [ Service-now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the below details:   1\. question: What is the purpose of resource tagging?
answer:
**Purpose of Resource Tagging**

Resource tagging is essential for describing the skillsets and skills of associates within an organization. The primary purposes of resource tagging include:

1. **Skill Identification**: It helps in identifying the specific skills and competencies of associates, making it easier for managers to find the right resources for particular tasks or projects .

2. **Resource Allocation**: By tagging resources with their skillsets, BGSW Managers can efficiently search for and allocate associates to projects that match their skills, ensuring optimal resource utilization .

3. **Project Suitability**: Resource tagging ensures that associates are tagged with skills relevant to the projects they are working on, which is crucial for project success .

4. **Improved Searchability**: When managers search for resources with specific skillsets, tagged resources can be easily located, streamlining the process of resource management .

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. How can I tag resources in the Planisware tool?
2. What are the consequences of not tagging resources properly?
3. Can I change the skillset of an associate after it has been tagged?

question: Hey BGSW what is ESS
answer:
**Employee Self-Service (ESS)**

Employee Self-Service (ESS) is a digital platform that allows associates to manage their personal information and access various services related to their employment. Here are some key features of ESS:

- **Personal Information Management**: Associates can update their personal details, such as home address and contact numbers, through the ESS portal .

- **Transport Services**: Employees can request transport services, including Employee Transport Services (ETS), BPO, and taxi rentals, via the online tool under Employee services .

- **Timesheet Management**: ESS provides functionalities for submitting and managing timesheets, including options for regularizing efforts not booked .

- **Access to Budget Management System**: Employees can navigate to the Budget Management System through the ESS page under Management Application .

For more detailed information, you can refer to the relevant documents or links provided in the responses.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What specific services can I access through the ESS platform?
2. How do I update my personal information in ESS?
3. Are there any training resources available for using ESS effectively?

context.content:
In general, transport services (ETS, BPO & taxi-rentals) are provided by Bosch-sourced service 

providers. The request shall be raised using the online tool under Employee services -> Travel -

> Transport Services, including from mobile application. 

5 ETS - (Employee Transport Services – General Shift and 
BPO) 

 

5.1 Registration in Transport Tool 

Associates are requested to update their respective address under ESS > HR Self-Service > 

Personal information > Address Data > Home address > Temporary address. They should also 

update their contact number under ‘Communication’.  

The associate should first update the address in HR data and then only should download 

MoveInSync mobile application through Play Store for Android and through App Store for IOS. 

Once the application has been downloaded, the associate can key-in their official mail ID for sign 

up and get registered for the respective technology support. It is mandatory for all associates to 

select their respective nodal point (locality) for further action. 

5.2 Scheduling in the Tool 

Associates are requested to schedule their regular pickup, with both login and logout schedule, 

well before the cut-off time for the maximum period of 5 working days for the upcoming week. 

This is applicable to both general shift associates and associates who work 24/7 round the clock 

(BPO). Only the associates who are authorized for 24/7 shifts are requested to schedule for their 

shift timings. Vehicles will be deployed based on occupancy and the same will be published via 

mobile application/web access. For the day operation (0601hrs to 1900hrs), nodal pickup and 

drop will be considered. Residential pickup and drop will be considered for the shift operation 



  Management System Policy                  Page 6 of 15

Process Description
In general, transport services (ETS, BPO & taxi-rentals) are provided by Bosch-sourced service providers. The request shall be raised using the online tool under Employee services -> Travel -> Transport Services, including from mobile application.
ETS - (Employee Transport Services – General Shift and BPO)

Registration in Transport Tool
Associates are requested to update their respective address under ESS > HR Self-Service > Personal information > Address Data > Home address > Temporary address. They should also update their contact number under ‘Communication’. 
The associate should first update the address in HR data and then only should download MoveInSync mobile application through Play Store for Android and through App Store for IOS. Once the application has been downloaded, the associate can key-in their official mail ID for sign up and get registered for the respective technology support. It is mandatory for all associates to select their respective nodal point (locality) for further action.
Scheduling in the Tool
Associates are requested to schedule their regular pickup, with both login and logout schedule, well before the cut-off time for the maximum period of 5 working days for the upcoming week. This is applicable to both general shift associates and associates who work 24/7 round the clock (BPO). Only the associates who are authorized for 24/7 shifts are requested to schedule for their shift timings. Vehicles will be deployed based on occupancy and the same will be published via mobile application/web access. For the day operation (0601hrs to 1900hrs), nodal pickup and drop will be considered. Residential pickup and drop will be considered for the shift operation (1901hrs to 0600hrs). Residential pickup/drop will be done only at the address mentioned in HR data.

Question 920) My timesheet is not approved due to some technical problem, I work in customer location and have Raised deputation leave for that period.  
Answer: In this scenario, since the Deputation leave is already applied the same will be considered for the attendance.   For the timesheet approval technical problem, please raise an [ Service-now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items).  

Question 921) Why is the status in Project Status Report showing Productivity Size not computed, though I have Every month computed metrics report in Project Status Report?  
Answer: To understand how the Pys is calculated refer [ PSR help](https://inside-hosted-apps.bosch.com/PRIME/PRIMECustomReports/Areas/Help%20Documents/PSRHelp.html?Instance=rbei)   Kindly contact [ BGSW/QMM-MAT ](wom.50900642-int@bcn.bosch.com) team to understand how Pys metric is computed in PSR.  

Question 922) How to delete timesheet?  
Answer: Please follow the below path to delete the Timesheet:   Go to Prime-> Timesheet-> Select the timesheet which you want to delete -> Click on Delete  

Question 923) How to change the Project Status Report period?  
Answer: Please be informed by default the Project Status Report month range for a project is from 1st to 31st of the month. This can be modified to 26th to 25th by using the "PSR Period Change" button available in Project Status Report Dashboard page.   Note:   Project Status Report Period can not be changed during the Project Status Report submission period (26th to 4th working day).  

Question 924) How to baseline the task?  
Answer: Please follow the steps explained in this [Video](https://tube.video.bosch.com/playlist/dedicated/2109/0_9aezr6zk/0_i3brh090 ) to baseline the tasks. Please raise an [ Service-now ](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items)ticket with the below details:   1\. Answer: At matrix parent project, there will be an additional indicator - "Child Projects Submission Status" which will be "Red" in color with the status "Not Submitted" when the linked projects have not submitted PQSR.   Also, the overall score will NOT be computed till all the lower level linked projects/sub-projects have not submitted PQSR. This information is available in tool with a label next to overall score.  

Question 810) The child project's Project Quality Status Report submission status is shown in red, what does this indicate?  
Answer: At matrix parent project, there will be an additional indicator - "Child Projects Submission Status" which will be "Red" in color with the status "Not Submitted" when the linked projects have not submitted PQSR.   Also, the overall score will NOT be computed till all the lower level linked projects/sub-projects have not submitted PQSR. This information is available in tool with a label next to overall score.  

Question 811) Where can I find the overall score of the projects submitted for the Project Quality Status Report?  
Answer: At matrix parent project, there will be an additional indicator - "Child Projects Submission Status" which will be "Red" in color with the status "Not Submitted" when the linked projects have not submitted PQSR.   Also, the overall score will NOT be computed till all the lower level linked projects/sub-projects have not submitted PQSR. This information is available in tool with a label next to overall score.  

Question 812) For Parent projects in the matrix, which is the score being sent to PRIME and shown in the reports?  
Answer: All matrix parent project will have an Individual Score (Q-Pr) and Overall Score. Overall Score will be the score that will be sent to PRIME and shown in PROMISE Reports. Overall Score is the least score of the parent project and lower level projects.

Question 724) I require Project Manager access for Prime scheduling and managing for my team?  
Answer: Please perform the following checks:   1.Ensure that you are the PM/Proxy PM for an inprogress project in PROMISE.   Watch the [ video](https://tube.video.bosch.com/playlist/dedicated/2109/0_adkvzp4m/0_2dyfy4nf).   2.If any updates on role is done in the PROMISE today then it will reflect in PRIME the next day. After which you will be able to access the MPP. 3.If you are trying to access existing project file you can ask owner of the file to add you as a resource and assign a dummy task. 4.Additionally you can check pre-requisites for associates who needs to start the Project scheduling with PRIME - MPP. Click here for the [ video](https://connect.bosch.com/wikis/home?lang=en-us#!/wiki/W4591d755da0e_4aee_85c3_ff1f1b256ff0/page/Prerequisites%20for%20PMs%20%26%20Proxy%20PMs%20who%20need%20to%20start%20scheduling%20with%20PRIME%20-%20MPP).   5.If still you are facing the same issue then please raise an [ Service- now](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) ticket with appropriate details (Project ID, Project Name, MPP Schedule file name).  

Question 725) I get an access denied message when I navigate to PSR. Please suggest.  
Answer: Project Status Report (PSR) can be submitted only by the associates who are designated as Project Manager or proxy Project Manager of in-progress Project/Subproject in PROMISE tool.   Applicability and access to PSR report can be referred from this [ link](https://rb-atm-wq1.apac.bosch.com/FileSystem/6f88f5cc-f5fb-40af- abc0-b74e82962e34/Dummyfile/PSR_NotDefined_Projects.xlsx).  

Question 726) In Project Status Report team strength is appearing wrong.  
Answer: The details of Team Strength Offshore and Team Strength Onsite get synchronized from PROMISE (Projects> Project Profile> Additional Information > Roles & Responsibilities > Team Members section) on daily basis and are non- editable in PRIME.

Question 730) How to get access to Project Status Reports?  
Answer: Project Status Report (PSR) can be submitted only by the associates who are designated as Project Manager or proxy Project Manager of in-progress Project/Subproject in PROMISE tool.   Applicability and access to PSR report can be referred from this [ link](https://rb-atm-wq1.apac.bosch.com/FileSystem/6f88f5cc-f5fb-40af- abc0-b74e82962e34/Dummyfile/PSR_NotDefined_Projects.xlsx).  

Question 731) How to edit the wrong details of Offshore and Onsite effort in Project Status Report?  
Answer: The details of Team Strength Offshore and Team Strength Onsite get synchronized from PROMISE (Projects> Project Profile> Additional Information > Roles & Responsibilities > Team Members section) on daily basis and are non- editable in PRIME.   * If utilization of associate is 100%, strength is considered as 1.0, else it is considered proportionately based on the utilization percentage.    o If “IsOnsite” is “Yes”, associate is considered for “Team Strength Onsite”, else associate will get considered for “Team Strength Offshore”.  

Question 732) Please support to unsubmit the Project Status Report.  
Answer: It is possible to un-submit and re-submit the PSR using the “Un-submit” button.

Question 646) I am facing the problem where my project is being displayed under Non applicable projects Even though it was initiated before 15th of the previous month.  
Answer: PSR is not defined for certain category of projects. You can check such category of projects in this [ link](https://rb-atm-wq1.apac.bosch.com/FileSystem/6f88f5cc-f5fb-40af- abc0-b74e82962e34/Dummyfile/PSR_NotDefined_Projects.xlsx).  

Question 647) I am not able to submit Project Status Report?  
Answer: In order to submit the Project Status Report you should be assigned as PM / proxy PM of the project/ subproject in PROMISE.   If you are already assigned as PM / Proxy PM of the project and still unable to submit the Project Status Report the last date of Project Status Report submissions may be over. Project Status Report can be submitted between 26th of the month to 4th working day of subsequent month.  

Question 648) I have lost all the schedule because of the error. It failed to publish the planned effort?  
Answer: Please raise an [ Service-now](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) ticket with the below details:   1\. Project ID   2\. Project name   3\. Relevant snapshot  

Question 649) What is IGPM MCR?  
Answer: IGPM MCR - Integrated Global Processes for BBM. MCR is focusing on the standardization of the Management of Costs and Resources for the global BBM (Bosch Business Sector for Mobility) development organization.  

Question 650) When logging to MS Project, error message received "You are trying to connect to project server 2013"  
Answer: Please write an email to [PRIME Communication 2.0](PRIME2.0.Communication@in.bosch.com) providing your workstation name

question: Hey BGSW what is ESS
answer:
**Employee Self-Service (ESS)**

Employee Self-Service (ESS) is a digital platform that allows associates to manage their personal information and access various services related to their employment. Here are some key features of ESS:

- **Personal Information Management**: Associates can update their personal details, such as home address and contact numbers, through the ESS portal .

- **Transport Services**: Employees can request transport services, including Employee Transport Services (ETS), BPO, and taxi rentals, via the online tool under Employee services .

- **Timesheet Management**: ESS provides functionalities for submitting and managing timesheets, including options for regularizing efforts not booked .

- **Access to Budget Management System**: Employees can navigate to the Budget Management System through the ESS page under Management Application .

For more detailed information, you can refer to the relevant documents or links provided in the citations.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What specific services can I access through the ESS platform?
2. How do I update my personal information in ESS?
3. Are there any training resources available for using ESS effectively?

context.content:
In general, transport services (ETS, BPO & taxi-rentals) are provided by Bosch-sourced service 

providers. The request shall be raised using the online tool under Employee services -> Travel -

> Transport Services, including from mobile application. 

5 ETS - (Employee Transport Services – General Shift and 
BPO) 

 

5.1 Registration in Transport Tool 

Associates are requested to update their respective address under ESS > HR Self-Service > 

Personal information > Address Data > Home address > Temporary address. They should also 

update their contact number under ‘Communication’.  

The associate should first update the address in HR data and then only should download 

MoveInSync mobile application through Play Store for Android and through App Store for IOS. 

Once the application has been downloaded, the associate can key-in their official mail ID for sign 

up and get registered for the respective technology support. It is mandatory for all associates to 

select their respective nodal point (locality) for further action. 

5.2 Scheduling in the Tool 

Associates are requested to schedule their regular pickup, with both login and logout schedule, 

well before the cut-off time for the maximum period of 5 working days for the upcoming week. 

This is applicable to both general shift associates and associates who work 24/7 round the clock 

(BPO). Only the associates who are authorized for 24/7 shifts are requested to schedule for their 

shift timings. Vehicles will be deployed based on occupancy and the same will be published via 

mobile application/web access. For the day operation (0601hrs to 1900hrs), nodal pickup and 

drop will be considered. Residential pickup and drop will be considered for the shift operation 



  Management System Policy                  Page 6 of 15 

QSPL-FCM-04 BGSW Transport Policy (All Locations)  Version 2.0

Question 628) My project is not appearing in prime tool timesheet, Due to this I am not able to fill the efforts. Please help me as soon as possible since the period is about to get closed?  
Answer: If the scheduled task in MPP, is not reflecting in Timesheet. Please watch this [ Video]( https://tube.video.bosch.com/playlist/dedicated/2109/0_adkvzp4m/0_vvz5bo7u) to see the possible causes for the same and steps to overcome.  

Question 629) I am not able to find how many have submitted the timesheet in History.  
Answer: If you are interested to see the daily saved/submitted/approved efforts then please go through 'Effort Dashboard' [ link]( https://app.powerbi.com/reportEmbed?reportId=f6967fb1-0edc-46bc-9eb0-25177cb681f0&autoAuth=true&ctid=0ae51e19-07c8-4e4b-bb6d-648ee58410f4).   And if you want to see how many of your associates are not submitted the timesheet then go through this Bosch Connect [ link](https://connect.bosch.com/wikis/home?lang=en-us#!/wiki/W4591d755da0e_4aee_85c3_ff1f1b256ff0/page/How%20to%20find%20the%20list%20of%20Timesheets%20not%20submitted%20by%20associates).   In case you just need to check names of associates who have entered timesheet for today, you can refer "Today's Timesheet Effort" option available in PRIME home page  

Question 630) My project is applicable for Cost of Quality report but not able to find in the list.  
Answer: Be notified that:   1.Cost of Quality Report is Not applicable for : RA / Innovation / Competency / ESS / Agile - SCRUM / Agile - SAFe category of projects.

GD&T Course content per ISO GPS standards 
 

1. Pre assessment test to understand the skills of participants 

2. Basics of ISO-GPS system of standards (ISO 8015) 

1 Objectives of the ISO-GPS system of standards (ISO 8015) 

2 Structure of the ISO-GPS system of standards 

2.1 Fundamental ISO-GPS standards 

2.2 General ISO-GPS standards 

3 Concepts, principals and rules acc. to ISO 8015:2011 

3. ISO 2768 general tolerances  

4. Dimensional tolerances (ISO 14405) 

1 Problem of unambiguous sizes 

2 Feature of size with linear sizes-terms acc. to ISO 14405-1: 2017 

3 Linear distances and radii (non-sizes) acc. to ISO 14405-2: 2017 

4 feature of size with angular size-terms acc. to ISO 14405-3:2017 

5 Two-point-size and consequences for technical drawings 

6 Envelope requirement acc. to ISO 14405-1 

7 Modifiers to specify the linear size characteristic (“GG”, “GN”, “LP”, etc.) 

5. Geometrical product specifications (GPS) —Geometrical tolerancing — 

          Datums and datum systems (ISO 5459:2011) 

1 Symbols, terms and definitions. 

2 Role of datums and general concepts 

3 Specification of datums and datum systems 

4 Single datum established from one single feature 

5 Common datum established from more than one feature 

6 Specification of datums and datum systems 

7. Datum targets

Applicable to all BGSW on-roll associates, external associates, trainees & interns. To have hassle-free transport under digital platform at Ban, Cob, Hyd & Pune.
Responsibility
FCM Department
Process Description
In general, transport services (ETS, BPO & taxi-rentals) are provided by Bosch-sourced service providers. The request shall be raised using the online tool under Employee services -> Travel -> Transport Services, including from mobile application.
ETS - (Employee Transport Services – General Shift and BPO)

Registration in Transport Tool
Associates are requested to update their respective address under ESS > HR Self-Service > Personal information > Address Data > Home address > Temporary address. They should also update their contact number under ‘Communication’. 
The associate should first update the address in HR data and then only should download MoveInSync mobile application through Play Store for Android and through App Store for IOS. Once the application has been downloaded, the associate can key-in their official mail ID for sign up and get registered for the respective technology support. It is mandatory for all associates to select their respective nodal point (locality) for further action.
Scheduling in the Tool
Associates are requested to schedule their regular pickup, with both login and logout schedule, well before the cut-off time for the maximum period of 5 working days for the upcoming week. This is applicable to both general shift associates and associates who work 24/7 round the clock (BPO). Only the associates who are authorized for 24/7 shifts are requested to schedule for their shift timings. Vehicles will be deployed based on occupancy and the same will be published via mobile application/web access. For the day operation (0601hrs to 1900hrs), nodal pickup and drop will be considered. Residential pickup and drop will be considered for the shift operation (1901hrs to 0600hrs). Residential pickup/drop will be done only at the address mentioned in HR data.

question: Hey BGSW what is ESS
answer:
Hello! 😊

**Employee Self-Service (ESS)** is a digital platform that allows associates to manage various personal and work-related tasks independently. It provides functionalities such as:

- **Updating Personal Information**: Associates can update their home address, contact numbers, and other personal details through the ESS portal .
  
- **Transport Services**: Employees can request transport services, including Employee Transport Services (ETS), through the ESS platform .

- **Access to Management Applications**: ESS includes access to tools like the Budget Management System (BMS) and other management applications .

For more detailed information, you can refer to the relevant documents or the Bosch Connect platform.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What specific features can I access through the ESS platform?
2. How do I navigate to the transport services section in ESS?
3. Are there any common issues associates face while using ESS?

context.content:
In general, transport services (ETS, BPO & taxi-rentals) are provided by Bosch-sourced service 

providers. The request shall be raised using the online tool under Employee services -> Travel -

> Transport Services, including from mobile application. 

5 ETS - (Employee Transport Services – General Shift and 
BPO) 

 

5.1 Registration in Transport Tool 

Associates are requested to update their respective address under ESS > HR Self-Service > 

Personal information > Address Data > Home address > Temporary address. They should also 

update their contact number under ‘Communication’.  

The associate should first update the address in HR data and then only should download 

MoveInSync mobile application through Play Store for Android and through App Store for IOS. 

Once the application has been downloaded, the associate can key-in their official mail ID for sign 

up and get registered for the respective technology support. It is mandatory for all associates to 

select their respective nodal point (locality) for further action. 

5.2 Scheduling in the Tool 

Associates are requested to schedule their regular pickup, with both login and logout schedule, 

well before the cut-off time for the maximum period of 5 working days for the upcoming week. 

This is applicable to both general shift associates and associates who work 24/7 round the clock 

(BPO). Only the associates who are authorized for 24/7 shifts are requested to schedule for their 

shift timings. Vehicles will be deployed based on occupancy and the same will be published via 

mobile application/web access. For the day operation (0601hrs to 1900hrs), nodal pickup and 

drop will be considered. Residential pickup and drop will be considered for the shift operation

question: Hey BGSW what is NPS
answer:
Hello! 😊

**NPS** stands for **Net Promoter Score**. It is a widely used metric for measuring customer loyalty and satisfaction. The NPS is calculated based on responses to a single question: 

*"On a scale from 0 to 10, how likely are you to recommend our company/product/service to a friend or colleague?"*

**Key Points about NPS:**

- **Scoring**: Respondents are categorized into three groups:
  - **Promoters (score 9-10)**: Loyal customers who are likely to recommend the company.
  - **Passives (score 7-8)**: Satisfied but unenthusiastic customers who are vulnerable to competitive offerings.
  - **Detractors (score 0-6)**: Unhappy customers who can damage the brand through negative word-of-mouth.

- **Calculation**: The NPS is calculated by subtracting the percentage of Detractors from the percentage of Promoters. The formula is:
  
  \[
  \text{NPS} = \% \text{Promoters} - \% \text{Detractors}
  \]

- **Interpretation**: The score can range from -100 to +100. A positive score indicates more Promoters than Detractors, which is generally a good sign of customer loyalty.

For more detailed insights on NPS, you might want to explore resources related to customer experience management.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. How can companies improve their NPS?
2. What are some common methods for collecting NPS feedback?
3. How does NPS compare to other customer satisfaction metrics?

Also, the overall score will NOT be computed till all the lower level linked projects/sub-projects have not submitted PQSR. Also, the overall score will NOT be computed till all the lower level linked projects/sub-projects have not submitted PQSR. This information is available in tool with a label next to overall score.  

Question 812) For Parent projects in the matrix, which is the score being sent to PRIME and shown in the reports?  
Answer: All matrix parent project will have an Individual Score (Q-Pr) and Overall Score. Overall Score will be the score that will be sent to PRIME and shown in PROMISE Reports. Overall Score is the least score of the parent project and lower level projects.

question: Hey BGSW what is ESS
answer:
Hello! 😊

**Employee Self-Service (ESS)** is a digital platform that allows associates to manage their personal information and access various services related to their employment. 

Key features of ESS include:

- **Personal Information Management**: Associates can update their personal details such as home address and contact numbers.
  
- **Transport Services**: Employees can request transport services through the online tool under Employee services -> Travel -> Transport Services, including mobile applications .

- **Timesheet Management**: Associates can submit and manage their timesheets, view history, and regularize efforts if needed .

- **Access to Management Applications**: ESS provides access to various management tools, including the Budget Management System .

For more detailed information, you can refer to the relevant documents or links provided in the responses.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What specific services can I access through the ESS platform?
2. How do I update my personal information in ESS?
3. Can you explain how to request transport services using ESS?

context.content:
In general, transport services (ETS, BPO & taxi-rentals) are provided by Bosch-sourced service 

providers. The request shall be raised using the online tool under Employee services -> Travel -

> Transport Services, including from mobile application. 

5 ETS - (Employee Transport Services – General Shift and 
BPO) 

 

5.1 Registration in Transport Tool 

Associates are requested to update their respective address under ESS > HR Self-Service > 

Personal information > Address Data > Home address > Temporary address. They should also 

update their contact number under ‘Communication’.  

The associate should first update the address in HR data and then only should download 

MoveInSync mobile application through Play Store for Android and through App Store for IOS. 

Once the application has been downloaded, the associate can key-in their official mail ID for sign 

up and get registered for the respective technology support. It is mandatory for all associates to 

select their respective nodal point (locality) for further action. 

5.2 Scheduling in the Tool 

Associates are requested to schedule their regular pickup, with both login and logout schedule, 

well before the cut-off time for the maximum period of 5 working days for the upcoming week. 

This is applicable to both general shift associates and associates who work 24/7 round the clock 

(BPO). Only the associates who are authorized for 24/7 shifts are requested to schedule for their 

shift timings. Vehicles will be deployed based on occupancy and the same will be published via 

mobile application/web access. For the day operation (0601hrs to 1900hrs), nodal pickup and 

drop will be considered. Residential pickup and drop will be considered for the shift operation 



  Management System Policy                  Page 6 of 15 

QSPL-FCM-04 BGSW Transport Policy (All Locations)  Version 2.0

Applicable to all BGSW on-roll associates, external associates, trainees & interns. To have hassle-free transport under digital platform at Ban, Cob, Hyd & Pune.
Responsibility
FCM Department
Process Description
In general, transport services (ETS, BPO & taxi-rentals) are provided by Bosch-sourced service providers. The request shall be raised using the online tool under Employee services -> Travel -> Transport Services, including from mobile application.
ETS - (Employee Transport Services – General Shift and BPO)

Registration in Transport Tool
Associates are requested to update their respective address under ESS > HR Self-Service > Personal information > Address Data > Home address > Temporary address. They should also update their contact number under ‘Communication’. 
The associate should first update the address in HR data and then only should download MoveInSync mobile application through Play Store for Android and through App Store for IOS. Once the application has been downloaded, the associate can key-in their official mail ID for sign up and get registered for the respective technology support. It is mandatory for all associates to select their respective nodal point (locality) for further action.
Scheduling in the Tool
Associates are requested to schedule their regular pickup, with both login and logout schedule, well before the cut-off time for the maximum period of 5 working days for the upcoming week. This is applicable to both general shift associates and associates who work 24/7 round the clock (BPO). Only the associates who are authorized for 24/7 shifts are requested to schedule for their shift timings. Vehicles will be deployed based on occupancy and the same will be published via mobile application/web access. For the day operation (0601hrs to 1900hrs), nodal pickup and drop will be considered. Residential pickup and drop will be considered for the shift operation (1901hrs to 0600hrs). Residential pickup/drop will be done only at the address mentioned in HR data.

question: Hey BGSW what is NPS
answer:
Hello! 😊

**NPS** stands for **Net Promoter Score**. It is a widely used metric for measuring customer loyalty and satisfaction. The NPS is calculated based on responses to a single question: 

*"On a scale from 0 to 10, how likely are you to recommend our company/product/service to a friend or colleague?"*

**Key Points about NPS:**

- **Promoters (score 9-10)**: These are loyal customers who are likely to make repeat purchases and refer others.
  
- **Passives (score 7-8)**: These customers are satisfied but not enthusiastic enough to be considered promoters.

- **Detractors (score 0-6)**: These customers are unhappy and can potentially harm your brand through negative word-of-mouth.

The NPS is calculated by subtracting the percentage of detractors from the percentage of promoters. This score can help organizations understand their customer satisfaction levels and identify areas for improvement.

For more detailed information, you can refer to resources on customer experience management.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. How can a company improve its NPS?
2. What are some common methods for collecting NPS feedback?
3. How does NPS compare to other customer satisfaction metrics?

Question 730) How to get access to Project Status Reports?  
Answer: Project Status Report (PSR) can be submitted only by the associates who are designated as Project Manager or proxy Project Manager of in-progress Project/Subproject in PROMISE tool.   Applicability and access to PSR report can be referred from this [ link](https://rb-atm-wq1.apac.bosch.com/FileSystem/6f88f5cc-f5fb-40af- abc0-b74e82962e34/Dummyfile/PSR_NotDefined_Projects.xlsx).  

Question 731) How to edit the wrong details of Offshore and Onsite effort in Project Status Report?  
Answer: The details of Team Strength Offshore and Team Strength Onsite get synchronized from PROMISE (Projects> Project Profile> Additional Information > Roles & Responsibilities > Team Members section) on daily basis and are non- editable in PRIME.   * If utilization of associate is 100%, strength is considered as 1.0, else it is considered proportionately based on the utilization percentage.    o If “IsOnsite” is “Yes”, associate is considered for “Team Strength Onsite”, else associate will get considered for “Team Strength Offshore”.  

Question 732) Please support to unsubmit the Project Status Report.  
Answer: It is possible to un-submit and re-submit the PSR using the “Un-submit” button.

Question 217) How to submit timesheet?  
Answer: You can refer [Timesheet Entry and Submission video](https://tube.video.bosch.com/playlist/dedicated/2109/0_8m0cd2jm/0_ojs7vzg4) [Additional tips on timesheet submission](https://tube.video.bosch.com/playlist/dedicated/2109/0_8m0cd2jm/0_xp4t01p3) which has all the required information on timesheet entry and submission details.  

Question 218) I am finding difference in the data available in Microsoft Project Professional file and Data Analysis Report.  
Answer: If you are facing any issues in the generated DAR report, here are a few tips to resolve it:   1\. Check if the project is applicable for Data Analysis Report (DAR).   2\. Check the latest computation date.   3\. Check if the MPP file was published with the actual work.   4\. Check if the daily computation is already 100% successful.   5\. Check the last published date after 24 hours.   6\. Check for which quarter is the report generated.**   If the task approvals have happened today, it will not reflect in the DAR report immediately. First, publish the project schedule file. Once published, kindly refer the DAR report on the next day for the effort information to get reflected.   Additionally, please check if the task is spanning across multiple months. In such a case, even the report data will be spanning across multiple months.   Please raise an [ Service-now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the below details:   1\. Project ID   2\. Project Name

Question 217) I am unable to view the details of the ticketing itinerary?
Answer: Even after receiving the Sent Itinerary email notification, if the ticket options are not visible in the SWIFT, please wait for a couple of hours for the data to reflect. If you find the answer helpful, you can simply express your appreciation by giving a 'thumbs up'. If no, then please give 'thumbs down'.

Question 218) What is the Turn around time for Travel settlement?
Answer: The Travel settlement for INR currency will be credited to the account within 3 to 4 working days from the date of Travel Plan closure. 
If the reimbursement is for other currencies, it will be paid in INR and the amount will be credited along with the salary. 

Note: 
• The settlement amount in other currencies which is closed on or before 20th of the month, will be credited in the same month salary.  
• If it is closed after 21st of the month, the amount will be credited in the next month salary. If you find the answer helpful, you can simply express your appreciation by giving a 'thumbs up'. If no, then please give 'thumbs down'.

Question 219) When will I get my SIM card?
Answer: After submitting the required documents to the mobility team, an email is sent to the user to collect the SIM card from the respective location. 
  Note:   For Coimbatore associates the SIM card is sent to the user by hauspost. If you find the answer helpful, you can simply express your appreciation by giving a 'thumbs up'. If no, then please give 'thumbs down'.

Question 220) View travel pdf link is not active?
Answer: Please note that only after all the approvals are completed you will be able to view the PDF. Please raise a ServiceNow ticket if the  View Travel PDF  is not visible in the Travel Request even after the travel approvals are completed. If you find the answer helpful, you can simply express your appreciation by giving a 'thumbs up'. If no, then please give 'thumbs down'.

Question 16) Save button is not enabled in Timesheet?  
Answer: Timesheets are closed regularly. Timesheets of CW1 are closed on Monday of CW3. Similarly, timesheets of CW2 are closed on Monday of CW4. Once the timesheet is closed, both Save and "Turn in final timesheet" options will be disabled in the timesheet.   For the issue of timesheet to getting opened, please raise an [ Service- now](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) ticket with the below details:   1\. Employee number   2\. NT/User id   3\. Screenshot of the error message obtained  

Question 17) I am unable to fetch the Data Analysis Report data. The page is blank on selecting the required duration.  
Answer: 1) Reports in PRIME are generally accessible by following category of users:   a. PMs and proxy PMs   b. First level management and above   c. QAs (FPQs, Sub-Key Account QAs, etc.)   2) You can refer the DAR [ Help Dashboard](https://bgsw-primepha.apac.bosch.com/PRIMECustomReports/Areas/Help%20Documents/DataAnalysisReportHelp.html?Instance=rbei)in PRIME for more information on DAR Report access permission   3) Select the Org details , Project , Report Name, and the Date range.****4) Raise an[ Service-now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) with the below details:**a. Project ID**b. Project Name**  

Question 18) I am not able to use PRIME application after my user migration to Germany. Moreover I am unable to raise a request through employee service portal. Could you help to solve this issue?  
Answer: In case you are not within Bosch Global Network, you will not be able to access PRIME.

question: Hey BGSW what is ESS
answer:
**Employee Self-Service (ESS)**

Employee Self-Service (ESS) is a digital platform that allows associates to manage their personal information and access various services related to their employment. Here are some key features of ESS:

- **Personal Information Management**: Associates can update their personal details, such as home address and contact numbers, through the ESS portal .

- **Transport Services**: Employees can request transport services, including Employee Transport Services (ETS), BPO, and taxi rentals, via the online tool under Employee services .

- **Timesheet Management**: ESS provides functionalities for submitting and managing timesheets, including options for regularizing efforts not booked .

- **Access to Budget Management System**: Employees can navigate to the Budget Management System through the ESS page under Management Application .

For more detailed information, you can refer to the relevant documents or links provided in the responses.

**Suggested follow-up questions:**

1. What specific services can I access through the ESS platform?
2. How do I update my personal information in ESS?
3. Can you explain the process for requesting transport services through ESS?

context.content:
In general, transport services (ETS, BPO & taxi-rentals) are provided by Bosch-sourced service 

providers. The request shall be raised using the online tool under Employee services -> Travel -

> Transport Services, including from mobile application. 

5 ETS - (Employee Transport Services – General Shift and 
BPO) 

 

5.1 Registration in Transport Tool 

Associates are requested to update their respective address under ESS > HR Self-Service > 

Personal information > Address Data > Home address > Temporary address. They should also 

update their contact number under ‘Communication’.  

The associate should first update the address in HR data and then only should download 

MoveInSync mobile application through Play Store for Android and through App Store for IOS. 

Once the application has been downloaded, the associate can key-in their official mail ID for sign 

up and get registered for the respective technology support. It is mandatory for all associates to 

select their respective nodal point (locality) for further action. 

5.2 Scheduling in the Tool 

Associates are requested to schedule their regular pickup, with both login and logout schedule, 

well before the cut-off time for the maximum period of 5 working days for the upcoming week. 

This is applicable to both general shift associates and associates who work 24/7 round the clock 

(BPO). Only the associates who are authorized for 24/7 shifts are requested to schedule for their 

shift timings. Vehicles will be deployed based on occupancy and the same will be published via 

mobile application/web access. For the day operation (0601hrs to 1900hrs), nodal pickup and 

drop will be considered. Residential pickup and drop will be considered for the shift operation 



  Management System Policy                  Page 6 of 15 

QSPL-FCM-04 BGSW Transport Policy (All Locations)  Version 2.0

Question 628) My project is not appearing in prime tool timesheet, Due to this I am not able to fill the efforts. Please help me as soon as possible since the period is about to get closed?

Question 629) I am not able to find how many have submitted the timesheet in History.  
Answer: If you are interested to see the daily saved/submitted/approved efforts then please go through 'Effort Dashboard' [ link]( https://app.powerbi.com/reportEmbed?reportId=f6967fb1-0edc-46bc-9eb0-25177cb681f0&autoAuth=true&ctid=0ae51e19-07c8-4e4b-bb6d-648ee58410f4).   And if you want to see how many of your associates are not submitted the timesheet then go through this Bosch Connect [ link](https://connect.bosch.com/wikis/home?lang=en-us#!/wiki/W4591d755da0e_4aee_85c3_ff1f1b256ff0/page/How%20to%20find%20the%20list%20of%20Timesheets%20not%20submitted%20by%20associates).   In case you just need to check names of associates who have entered timesheet for today, you can refer "Today's Timesheet Effort" option available in PRIME home page  

Question 630) My project is applicable for Cost of Quality report but not able to find in the list.  
Answer: Be notified that:   1.Cost of Quality Report is Not applicable for : RA / Innovation / Competency / ESS / Agile - SCRUM / Agile - SAFe category of projects.

Applicable to all BGSW on-roll associates, external associates, trainees & interns. To have hassle-free transport under digital platform at Ban, Cob, Hyd & Pune.
Responsibility
FCM Department
Process Description
In general, transport services (ETS, BPO & taxi-rentals) are provided by Bosch-sourced service providers. The request shall be raised using the online tool under Employee services -> Travel -> Transport Services, including from mobile application.
ETS - (Employee Transport Services – General Shift and BPO)

Registration in Transport Tool
Associates are requested to update their respective address under ESS > HR Self-Service > Personal information > Address Data > Home address > Temporary address. They should also update their contact number under ‘Communication’. 
The associate should first update the address in HR data and then only should download MoveInSync mobile application through Play Store for Android and through App Store for IOS. Once the application has been downloaded, the associate can key-in their official mail ID for sign up and get registered for the respective technology support. It is mandatory for all associates to select their respective nodal point (locality) for further action.
Scheduling in the Tool
Associates are requested to schedule their regular pickup, with both login and logout schedule, well before the cut-off time for the maximum period of 5 working days for the upcoming week. This is applicable to both general shift associates and associates who work 24/7 round the clock (BPO). Only the associates who are authorized for 24/7 shifts are requested to schedule for their shift timings. Vehicles will be deployed based on occupancy and the same will be published via mobile application/web access. For the day operation (0601hrs to 1900hrs), nodal pickup and drop will be considered. Residential pickup and drop will be considered for the shift operation (1901hrs to 0600hrs). Residential pickup/drop will be done only at the address mentioned in HR data.

Question 920) My timesheet is not approved due to some technical problem, I work in customer location and have Raised deputation leave for that period.  
Answer: In this scenario, since the Deputation leave is already applied the same will be considered for the attendance.   For the timesheet approval technical problem, please raise an [ Service-now ticket](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items).  

Question 921) Why is the status in Project Status Report showing Productivity Size not computed, though I have Every month computed metrics report in Project Status Report?  
Answer: To understand how the Pys is calculated refer [ PSR help](https://inside-hosted-apps.bosch.com/PRIME/PRIMECustomReports/Areas/Help%20Documents/PSRHelp.html?Instance=rbei)   Kindly contact [ BGSW/QMM-MAT ](wom.50900642-int@bcn.bosch.com) team to understand how Pys metric is computed in PSR.  

Question 922) How to delete timesheet?  
Answer: Please follow the below path to delete the Timesheet:   Go to Prime-> Timesheet-> Select the timesheet which you want to delete -> Click on Delete  

Question 923) How to change the Project Status Report period?  
Answer: Please be informed by default the Project Status Report month range for a project is from 1st to 31st of the month. This can be modified to 26th to 25th by using the "PSR Period Change" button available in Project Status Report Dashboard page.   Note:   Project Status Report Period can not be changed during the Project Status Report submission period (26th to 4th working day).  

Question 924) How to baseline the task?  
Answer: Please follow the steps explained in this [Video](https://tube.video.bosch.com/playlist/dedicated/2109/0_9aezr6zk/0_i3brh090 ) to baseline the tasks. Please raise an [ Service-now ](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items)ticket with the below details:   1\. Question 730) How to get access to Project Status Reports?  
Answer: Project Status Report (PSR) can be submitted only by the associates who are designated as Project Manager or proxy Project Manager of in-progress Project/Subproject in PROMISE tool.   Applicability and access to PSR report can be referred from this [ link](https://rb-atm-wq1.apac.bosch.com/FileSystem/6f88f5cc-f5fb-40af- abc0-b74e82962e34/Dummyfile/PSR_NotDefined_Projects.xlsx).  

Question 731) How to edit the wrong details of Offshore and Onsite effort in Project Status Report?  
Answer: The details of Team Strength Offshore and Team Strength Onsite get synchronized from PROMISE (Projects> Project Profile> Additional Information > Roles & Responsibilities > Team Members section) on daily basis and are non- editable in PRIME.   * If utilization of associate is 100%, strength is considered as 1.0, else it is considered proportionately based on the utilization percentage.    o If “IsOnsite” is “Yes”, associate is considered for “Team Strength Onsite”, else associate will get considered for “Team Strength Offshore”.  

Question 732) Please support to unsubmit the Project Status Report.  
Answer: It is possible to un-submit and re-submit the PSR using the “Un-submit” button.

Question 724) I require Project Manager access for Prime scheduling and managing for my team?  
Answer: Please perform the following checks:   1.Ensure that you are the PM/Proxy PM for an inprogress project in PROMISE.   Watch the [ video](https://tube.video.bosch.com/playlist/dedicated/2109/0_adkvzp4m/0_2dyfy4nf).   2.If any updates on role is done in the PROMISE today then it will reflect in PRIME the next day. After which you will be able to access the MPP. 3.If you are trying to access existing project file you can ask owner of the file to add you as a resource and assign a dummy task. 4.Additionally you can check pre-requisites for associates who needs to start the Project scheduling with PRIME - MPP. Click here for the [ video](https://connect.bosch.com/wikis/home?lang=en-us#!/wiki/W4591d755da0e_4aee_85c3_ff1f1b256ff0/page/Prerequisites%20for%20PMs%20%26%20Proxy%20PMs%20who%20need%20to%20start%20scheduling%20with%20PRIME%20-%20MPP).   5.If still you are facing the same issue then please raise an [ Service- now](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) ticket with appropriate details (Project ID, Project Name, MPP Schedule file name).  

Question 725) I get an access denied message when I navigate to PSR. Please suggest.  
Answer: Project Status Report (PSR) can be submitted only by the associates who are designated as Project Manager or proxy Project Manager of in-progress Project/Subproject in PROMISE tool.   Applicability and access to PSR report can be referred from this [ link](https://rb-atm-wq1.apac.bosch.com/FileSystem/6f88f5cc-f5fb-40af- abc0-b74e82962e34/Dummyfile/PSR_NotDefined_Projects.xlsx).  

Question 726) In Project Status Report team strength is appearing wrong.  
Answer: The details of Team Strength Offshore and Team Strength Onsite get synchronized from PROMISE (Projects> Project Profile> Additional Information > Roles & Responsibilities > Team Members section) on daily basis and are non- editable in PRIME.

Question 646) I am facing the problem where my project is being displayed under Non applicable projects Even though it was initiated before 15th of the previous month.  
Answer: PSR is not defined for certain category of projects. You can check such category of projects in this [ link](https://rb-atm-wq1.apac.bosch.com/FileSystem/6f88f5cc-f5fb-40af- abc0-b74e82962e34/Dummyfile/PSR_NotDefined_Projects.xlsx).  

Question 647) I am not able to submit Project Status Report?  
Answer: In order to submit the Project Status Report you should be assigned as PM / proxy PM of the project/ subproject in PROMISE.   If you are already assigned as PM / Proxy PM of the project and still unable to submit the Project Status Report the last date of Project Status Report submissions may be over. Project Status Report can be submitted between 26th of the month to 4th working day of subsequent month.  

Question 648) I have lost all the schedule because of the error. It failed to publish the planned effort?  
Answer: Please raise an [ Service-now](https://boschindia.service-now.com/sp?id=sc_cat_item&sys_id=9bd938621bcfd510ce4f628ee54bcb05&referrer=popular_items) ticket with the below details:   1\. Project ID   2\. Project name   3\. Relevant snapshot  

Question 649) What is IGPM MCR?  
Answer: IGPM MCR - Integrated Global Processes for BBM. MCR is focusing on the standardization of the Management of Costs and Resources for the global BBM (Bosch Business Sector for Mobility) development organization.  

Question 650) When logging to MS Project, error message received "You are trying to connect to project server 2013"  
Answer: Please write an email to [PRIME Communication 2.0](PRIME2.0.Communication@in.bosch.com) providing your workstation name

question: Hey BGSW what is ESS
answer:
**Employee Self-Service (ESS)**

Employee Self-Service (ESS) is a digital platform that allows associates to manage their personal information and access various services related to their employment. Here are some key features of ESS:

- **Personal Information Management**: Associates can update their personal details, such as home address and contact numbers, through the ESS portal .

- **Transport Services**: Employees can request transport services, including Employee Transport Services (ETS), BPO, and taxi rentals, via the online tool under Employee services .

- **Timesheet Management**: ESS provides functionalities for submitting and managing timesheets, including options for regularizing efforts not booked .

- **Access to Budget Management System**: Employees can navigate to the Budget Management System through the ESS page under Management Application .

For more detailed information, you can refer to the relevant documents or links provided in the citations.

**Suggested follow-up questions**

- What specific services can I access through the ESS platform?
- How do I update my personal information in ESS?
- Are there any training resources available for using ESS effectively?

In general, transport services (ETS, BPO & taxi-rentals) are provided by Bosch-sourced service 

providers. The request shall be raised using the online tool under Employee services -> Travel -

> Transport Services, including from mobile application. 

5 ETS - (Employee Transport Services – General Shift and 
BPO) 

 

5.1 Registration in Transport Tool 

Associates are requested to update their respective address under ESS > HR Self-Service > 

Personal information > Address Data > Home address > Temporary address. They should also 

update their contact number under ‘Communication’.  

The associate should first update the address in HR data and then only should download 

MoveInSync mobile application through Play Store for Android and through App Store for IOS. 

Once the application has been downloaded, the associate can key-in their official mail ID for sign 

up and get registered for the respective technology support. It is mandatory for all associates to 

select their respective nodal point (locality) for further action. 

5.2 Scheduling in the Tool 

Associates are requested to schedule their regular pickup, with both login and logout schedule, 

well before the cut-off time for the maximum period of 5 working days for the upcoming week. 

This is applicable to both general shift associates and associates who work 24/7 round the clock 

(BPO). Only the associates who are authorized for 24/7 shifts are requested to schedule for their 

shift timings. Vehicles will be deployed based on occupancy and the same will be published via 

mobile application/web access. For the day operation (0601hrs to 1900hrs), nodal pickup and 

drop will be considered. Residential pickup and drop will be considered for the shift operation

question: Hey BGSW what is NPS
answer:
**Net Promoter Score (NPS)**

Net Promoter Score (NPS) is a widely used metric for measuring customer loyalty and satisfaction. It is based on a single question survey that asks customers how likely they are to recommend a company's product or service to others, typically on a scale from 0 to 10. 

**Key Components of NPS:**

- **Promoters (Score 9-10)**: These are loyal customers who are likely to make repeat purchases and refer others.

- **Passives (Score 7-8)**: These customers are satisfied but not enthusiastic enough to be considered promoters. They are vulnerable to competitive offerings.

- **Detractors (Score 0-6)**: These customers are unhappy and can damage your brand through negative word-of-mouth.

**Calculating NPS:**

NPS is calculated by subtracting the percentage of detractors from the percentage of promoters:

\[ \text{NPS} = \% \text{Promoters} - \% \text{Detractors} \]

The score can range from -100 to +100, with higher scores indicating better customer loyalty.

For more detailed information, you can refer to resources on customer experience management or specific NPS guides.

**Suggested follow-up questions**

- How can businesses improve their NPS?
- What are some common methods for collecting NPS feedback?
- How does NPS compare to other customer satisfaction metrics?

Answer: At matrix parent project, there will be an additional indicator - "Child Projects Submission Status" which will be "Red" in color with the status "Not Submitted" when the linked projects have not submitted PQSR.   Also, the overall score will NOT be computed till all the lower level linked projects/sub-projects have not submitted PQSR. This information is available in tool with a label next to overall score.  

Question 810) The child project's Project Quality Status Report submission status is shown in red, what does this indicate?  
Answer: At matrix parent project, there will be an additional indicator - "Child Projects Submission Status" which will be "Red" in color with the status "Not Submitted" when the linked projects have not submitted PQSR.   Also, the overall score will NOT be computed till all the lower level linked projects/sub-projects have not submitted PQSR. This information is available in tool with a label next to overall score.  

Question 811) Where can I find the overall score of the projects submitted for the Project Quality Status Report?  
Answer: At matrix parent project, there will be an additional indicator - "Child Projects Submission Status" which will be "Red" in color with the status "Not Submitted" when the linked projects have not submitted PQSR.   Also, the overall score will NOT be computed till all the lower level linked projects/sub-projects have not submitted PQSR. This information is available in tool with a label next to overall score.  

Question 812) For Parent projects in the matrix, which is the score being sent to PRIME and shown in the reports?  
Answer: All matrix parent project will have an Individual Score (Q-Pr) and Overall Score. Overall Score will be the score that will be sent to PRIME and shown in PROMISE Reports. Overall Score is the least score of the parent project and lower level projects.
